Title: Biological Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

The Company

Syngenta is a leading developer and producer of seeds. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity’s most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

For a new opening in the team, we are looking for a:

Biological Data Scientist

Job Description

Into Action

Are you ready to make a significant impact in the agricultural industry? Look no further! The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) at Syngenta is seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. As a Data Scientist at VSET, you will be an integral part of a multidisciplinary team, working closely with stakeholders across the vegetable business. Your primary focus will be on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and artificial intelligence systems. By automating measurements and leveraging AI, you will gain a deep understanding of seed physiology and develop data-based solutions for the challenges faced by the global vegetable business.

The Challenge

When you are established in your role, you will work with the VSET team to;


Automate seed and plant measurements, developing algorithms for predicting seed performance.
Combine expertise in image analysis, machine learning, seed physiology, and biological experimentation.
Lead implementation and technology transfer to processing sites.
Actively participate in Syngenta's network of imaging and AI technologies.


Qualifications

Your Profile


To succeed in this role, you preferably have a Ph.D. or MSc degree with 3+ years of experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
You are familiar with machine/deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch.
Experience in deploying image analysis pipelines on the edge or in the cloud would be advantageous.
It would be a big plus if you have a strong interest in developing skills in chemometrics, spectroscopy, hyperspectral imaging, and establish a strong basic understanding of seed and plant biology.
You have good communication skills to interact with diverse internal stakeholders.


We will take care of a great onboarding, to make sure you feel comfortable and have all the necessary tools to start your new challenge.

Additional Information

Your Chance!

Join us at Syngenta and be part of a diverse and inclusive team that is passionate about shaping the future of sustainable agriculture. We offer a competitive salary package, excellent benefits and ample opportunities for professional growth and development.

If you recognize yourself in the profile and would like to apply for this position, please apply online via www.syngenta.com If you would like to have more information about this vacancy please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin by email to nienke.terluin@syngenta.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Avery Dennison Corporation (NYSE: AVY) is a global materials science and digital identification solutions company that provides a wide range of branding and information solutions that optimize labor and supply chain efficiency, reduce waste, advance sustainability, circularity and transparency, and better connect brands and consumers. Our products and solutions include labeling and functional materials, radio frequency identification (RFID) inlays and tags, software applications that connect the physical and digital, and a variety of products and solutions that enhance branded packaging and carry or display information that improves the customer experience. Serving an array of industries worldwide — including home and personal care, apparel, general retail, e-commerce, logistics, food and grocery, pharmaceuticals and automotive — we employ approximately 35,000 employees in more than 50 countries. Our reported sales in 2023 were $8.4 billion. Learn more at www.averydennison.com.

Avery Dennison is an equal opportunity employer.
Please let us know if we can support you with reasonable accommodationsthroughout the application process by contacting our team viaRequestaccomodation@eu.averydennison.com.



Job Description



ABOUT YOUR ROLE:

The Data Scientist will be joining the European Materials Group Finance team and will work on some of the most interesting and challenging business problems, with the goal to to drive better business insights, improve efficiency and unlock value for our customers. In this role you will interact with business leaders across functions and engage the business in data-driven debates.

​You will utilize your skills and experience to systematically answer questions using data to provide actionable recommendations. You will commonly utilize advanced statistical analysis and machine learning techniques. You will be responsible for modeling complex problems, discovering insights and identifying opportunities through the use of statistical, algorithmic, mining and visualization techniques. A successful candidate will have demonstrated experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations, such that they can efficiently and effectively develop solutions to a broad array of use cases.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:

Interpreting and analyzing data using exploratory mathematic and statistical techniques based on the scientific method

Formulating and leading guided, multifaceted analytic studies against large volumes of data

Coordinating research and analytic activities utilizing various data points unstructured and structured and employ programming to clean, massage, and organize the data

Analyzing problems and determining root causes

Translating complex results into simple, clear conclusions and visualizations

Explaining sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner

Defining company data assets, data models, and jobs to populate data models

Working closely with all European business units and cross functional teams to develop future models with the ability to link results to business processes

Coordinating with Data Engineers to build data environments providing data identified by Knowledge Managers and Analysts

Experimenting against data points, providing information based on experiment results and providing previously undiscovered solutions to command data challenges



Qualifications



WHAT WE WILL BE LOOKING FOR IN YOU:

Bachelor’s, Master’s degree (preferred), or other advanced degree required in computer science, business analytics, applied mathematics, statistics, machine learning, or other data centric discipline

4+ years of relevant industry work experience providing advanced analytics solutions, with a focus on Forecasting based models.

Proficiency with one or more programming languages: Java, NodeJS, Python, R

Knowledgeable in some Cloud and Big Data technologies, such as Microsoft Azure, Azure Data Lake, Databricks, Google Cloud Platform, Apache Spark

Analytics skills: descriptive statistical modeling & algorithms, machine learning algorithms, modeling dataset building, optimization, data visualization, pattern/cluster/segmentation analysis, predictive analytics, Analytics tools and Technologies like Qlikview, Cognos, Visual Basic, Apache, Oracle, SQL, GraphQL, NoSQL

Exceptional record of academic achievement, professional accomplishment, project management, and leadership

Passion for building and comfort working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)

Advanced analytical knowledge of data, ability to conduct big data analysis, data conditioning experience, programming advanced computing skill

Additional experience in core analytic methods such as predictive modeling and customer and product segmentation/clustering

Business sense: Basic knowledge of finance, manufacturing and commercial business processes and ability to translate business needs into data and explain complex concepts in an understandable manner

Project lead experience of cross functional teams is strongly preferred



Additional Information



We offer:

Attractive salary package
Workplace & work hours flexibility
Structured learning and development / Mentoring program
International environment
Events such as International Women’s Day, Earth Day, etc.
A growing and welcoming team with good spirit!

Who we are! - Our Story:

Every voice. Every day!Eight Values. One Team!

Being open to every voice, every day, brings our value of diversity to life and makes Avery Dennison a vibrant and engaging place to be. We understand diversity and equal opportunities as enrichment for our future-oriented work. Across our diverse, global team, every voice makes us stronger. When we listen to and learn from each other, there is no limit to what we can achieve together. Each of us is unique, and we appreciate bringing together different personalities and talents.

Avery Dennison is an equal-opportunity employer. In theEMEA region, we have theseEmployee Resource Groups:

EmpoWer- focusing on the engagement, mentoring, and promotion of women
Mental Health- striving to provide a safe space for employees to discuss mental health issues in the workplace
Unite- supporting the LGBTQI+ and ally community in the EMEA region

To find out more aboutall our employee resources groups globallyas well as ourDiversity, Equity & Inclusionapproach, please go to our Diversity and Inclusion pages in the About Us section of our website:https://www.averydennison.com/en/home/about-us/diversity-and-inclusion.html

At Avery Dennison, we do what we love, and we love what we do - Just click here, and get to know us better:Life @ Avery Dennison(linkedin.com/company/avery-dennison/life/emea)

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Do you feel a continuous hunger for data, complex analyses and the insights that come from it? Are you an expert in the field of data science, do you recognize patterns in marketing data and do you have experience with Marketing Mix Modelling? Do you want to continue to develop and challenge yourself by standing at the forefront of the use of modern tools, methods, technologies and enjoy wide variety of tasks in your job?


Annalect helps advertisers to improve data-driven marketing results and increase marketing efficiency. About half of the colleagues at Annalect are analysts or data scientists. We have expertise in the field of multi-touch attribution, marketing mix modeling, cross-media effect research and consumer behaviour. Together, we have the power to solve the most complex and relevant analysis issues. Annalect is part of the OmnicomMediaGroup and we work in the Netherlands for brands like Renault, L'Oréal, PepsiCo, McDonald's and many others.


What are you going to do?

As a Data Scientist at Annalect, you will be responsible for developing and using state-of-the-art analytical solutions and making a measurable impact by the usage of our data sources. Working with big data is just a beginning, as its extensivity is an important factor in many of our solutions. For example, you will work on:

  • Marketing Mix Modeling, in which you investigate which media mix is most effective for our clients.
  • Decision trees that provide insight into how people make a certain purchase decision.
  • Clustering models that provide insight into the different ways people perceive and interacting with ads.


As a Data Scientist, you are constantly challenged to use complex methods to help our customers achieve their goals. You combine flawless execution with the ability to explain complex solutions in understandable manner to customers and colleagues


What we look for:

  • A love for data, complex analyses and the insights that come from them;
  • 3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role, preferably within marketing;
  • Very thorough knowledge of programming statistical analyses in R or Python;
  • Experience working with mainstream database systems such as PostgreSQL, Spark, or Hive;
  • Strive to get the most out of data and technology. Both in terms of content, by bringing out the sharpest insights, and in terms of technology, by automating processes as much as possible;
  • A drive to collaborate, both within OMG and beyond;
  • Good communication and presentation skills. You should be able to oversee the implications of customer questions and discuss them with other specialists;
  • You like to share your knowledge and skills with others, dedicate the time to level up the team.


What we offer:


  • A good salary and terms of employment based on 37,5 hours per week;
  • A great job in an innovative environment where technology, data and analytics are the core, and no two days are the same;
  • opportunity to fully focus on developing your expertise within marketing mix modelling, attribution and experimentation;
  • The opportunity to further scale up our fast-growing partnerships with Meta and Google, with plenty of room for your own initiative;
  • Being part of a multi disciplinary and multi cultural team of highly talented specialists who want to share their knowledge with you, but also want to learn from you;
  • An international data science community where you can spar about innovations that have a global impact;
  • 27 days of holiday + 2 days off (Diversidays);
  • Facilitating a home workplace;
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid working;
  • Possibility to work abroad 6 weeks a year;
  • Take unlimited courses via Onelearning;
  • And more! :)


*Please note that we are not an official IND sponsor at the moment.


Let´s go!


If you would like to know more about this position, please contact Talent Acquisition via werken@omnicommediagroup.com or to Monica Miziolek via monika.miziolek@annalect.com.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Als Junior Data Scientist kom je te werken bij één van de grootste ingenieursadviesbureaus van Nederland. Dit bedrijf heeft ruim 2.000 medewerkers, verspreidt over 5 locaties en richt zich op grote infrastructurele projecten. Hierbij kan gedacht worden aan projecten op het gebied van (rail)infrastructuur, mobiliteit, ruimte, water en energie.




Als Junior Data Scientist maak je onderdeel uit van de adviesgroep dat zich bezighoudt met een diverse scope aan civiel technische vraagstukken. Dit zijn veelal vraagstukken met een forse schaalgrootte gerelateerd aan dynamische problemen. Hierbij kan bijvoorbeeld gedacht worden aan trillingsvraagstukken. Je zal dan ook dagelijks worden uitgedaagd om jouw analytische vaardigheden ten volle te benutten! Als Junior Data Scientist voer je complexe analyses en berekeningen uit op basis van zelf gebouwde modellen en kan je de volgende werkzaamheden verwachten:




Je gaat je bezighouden met het verzamelen van data omtrent een klantspecifiek vraagstuk met behulp van de door jou gebouwde modellen
Je zal naar buiten gaan voor het uitvoeren van metingen in het veld
Je bent bezig met het bruikbaar maken van verzamelde data
Je zal je analytische skills loslaten op de data
Je zult je bezighouden met het valideren van modelberekeningen
Tot slot zal je adviesrapporten opstellen op basis van de door jou verzamelde gegevens.




Als Junior Data Scientist moet je voldoen aan de volgende eisen:

Je hebt een afgeronde WO opleiding in een sterk technische richting zoals Applied Physics, Civiele techniek, Mechanical Engineering of soortgelijk
Je bent communicatief goed vaardig
Je hebt sterke affiniteit met automatiseren
Je beheerst zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal

Hierbij kan gedacht worden aan projecten op het gebied van (rail)infrastructuur, mobiliteit, ruimte, water en energie.


Als Junior Data Scientist maak je onderdeel uit van de adviesgroep dat zich bezighoudt met een diverse scope aan civiel technische vraagstukken. Dit zijn veelal vraagstukken met een forse schaalgrootte gerelateerd aan dynamische problemen. Hierbij kan bijvoorbeeld gedacht worden aan trillingsvraagstukken. Je zal dan ook dagelijks worden uitgedaagd om jouw analytische vaardigheden ten volle te benutten! Als Junior Data Scientist voer je complexe analyses en berekeningen uit op basis van zelf gebouwde modellen en kan je de volgende werkzaamheden verwachten:


  • Je gaat je bezighouden met het verzamelen van data omtrent een klantspecifiek vraagstuk met behulp van de door jou gebouwde modellen
  • Je zal naar buiten gaan voor het uitvoeren van metingen in het veld
  • Je bent bezig met het bruikbaar maken van verzamelde data
  • Je zal je analytische skills loslaten op de data
  • Je zult je bezighouden met het valideren van modelberekeningen
  • Tot slot zal je adviesrapporten opstellen op basis van de door jou verzamelde gegevens.


Als Junior Data Scientist moet je voldoen aan de volgende eisen:

  • Je hebt een afgeronde WO opleiding in een sterk technische richting zoals Applied Physics, Civiele techniek, Mechanical Engineering of soortgelijk
  • Je bent communicatief goed vaardig
  • Je hebt sterke affiniteit met automatiseren
  • Je beheerst zowel de Nederlandse als Engelse taal

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Utrecht Omgeving - Retail - Fulltime




Breng dit data team naar een hoger niveau met je expertise in ML/AI! en jij een expert in het benutten van AI/ML en kun je Data Scientists helpen bij het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van productieklare modellen? Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het data analytics team voor een grote retailer in Nederland. Jij bent de specialist in MLOps en Cloud Computing, verantwoordelijk voor het productieklaar maken van AI/ML-oplossingen. Hiermee sla je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega's (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistiek, assortimentsoptimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.




Werkzaamheden:




Je werkt samen met het Data Science-team om sterke AI/ML-modellen te creëren, waarbij je zorgt voor grondige monitoring van de proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om fouten en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je biedt advies en oplossingen voor technische uitdagingen die zich tijdens het ontwikkelingsproces voordoen.
Als specialist in MLOps en CI/CD onderhoud en verbeter je continu de modellen.
Je fungeert als verbindingspersoon tussen Data Science en Global IT voor het gebruik van technologieën zoals Databricks en Azure, die door Global IT worden beheerd.
Je draagt actief bij aan de vooruitgang van technologie en tools door het ontwikkelen van utility packages en het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps-methodologie.
Je blijft op de hoogte van innovaties binnen MLOps en bepaalt hoe deze kunnen bijdragen aan de doelen.







Wat zit erin voor jou?




Een dynamische omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren en plezier hebt door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding
24 vakantiedagen en extra dagen op fulltime basis.
Mogelijkheid tot 19 extra vakantiedagen + mogelijkheid tot kopen of verkopen van vakantiedagen
Korting bij de retailer zelf
Leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met een interne academy.
2-3 dagen per week vanuit huis kunnen werken, flexibele uren
Kilometer vergoeding voor reis naar het kantoor.




Wie ben jij?

3+ jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of Data Scientist met affiniteit voor ML
Expertise in Python, PySpark en SQL
Ervaring met MLOps/ CI/CD cyclus en Git
Werken in scrumteams
Kennis van Databricks en Azure
Teamspirit en kunnen sparren met je collega's om zo mogelijke oplossingen voor te leggen.
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels




Ben jij de juiste fit? Neem nu contact op :)

Show more

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: (Junior) Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about data modelling and do you want to make a lasting impact? Do you aspire to gain hands-on experience as a data scientist across various sectors? Are you seeking a dynamic environment where you can kick-start your career with extensive learning opportunities, including on-the-job coaching and a diverse training curriculum? If so, consider applying for the Junior Data Scientist position at IG&H!




As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in helping our clients derive valuable and new insights from large and complex datasets. You start doing this by creating deep understanding of the challenges our clients are facing. Together with your team, you’ll then determine how to create most business value for our clients. Afterward, you’ll apply your knowledge and skills on data modelling in a practical setting. Methods we use range from more basic data processing techniques to machine learning and large language models. Finally, you communicate and present results convincingly, to create real and lasting impact. We believe that those who can combine analytical skills with business sense are most successful in creating this impact for our clients.




IG&H is active in three sectors (retail, financial services and health), allowing you to get experience on a variety of projects. On top, you'll be working closely with IG&H consultants outside of the Data & Analytics team too, such that you learn much more than only data related skills. Especially if you start your career at IG&H, this will help you in understanding what you really like doing and want to learn.




Next to excellent employment conditions, working at IG&H will be a great place to kick-start your career. We believe that a caring and fun working environment will help you to dare to step out of your comfort zone and learn. In addition, we offer continuous learning through the IG&H Academy, in which you’ll get training to boost your data science, consulting and people skills. Also, you will be assigned a mentor, who will be there for you to provide you with guidance.




Above all, people are at the heart of what we do. This of course comes back in the work we deliver for our clients (why make a data product if the people who need to use it don’t understand or want to use it?). At the same time, a fun working culture is key for who we are. With an inspiring office in Utrecht where we can connect, have abundant parties, team activities and sport events (both organized for the entire IG&H organization as well as specifically for the Data & Analytics team), IG&H is truly a Great Place To Work. And yes, we are certified!




“In addition to on-the-job learning, you learn everything you need to know about consultancy in the IG&H Academy. The program consists of various internal and external training courses and has been specifically developed for trainees. Besides training sessions, the Academy often organizes trips and dinners. Through these, you quickly develop good relationships with co-workers at IG&H. I see many of them outside of work on a regular basis” Jasmijn Haverhals (Consultant Healthcare)




“The most beautiful thing about consulting is the diversity within the projects. IG&H offers next to different clients, a variety in the types of assignments. One assignment could be very strategic, in which you outline the direction of a company. Whereas another assignment could be focused on implementation, in which you are working together with the client to deliver concrete results.” Peter Hardy (Director)




What we ask:

MSc degree in Econometrics, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence or similar field
You have excellent Dutch and English communication skills, due to client needs
Analytical, inventive and practical
Python and/or R skills




What we offer you:

Working at a Great Place To Work with a pleasant atmosphere, enthusiastic colleagues who support you and many fun activities
Continuous development through the IG&H Academy and active on the job coaching
Permanent (indefinite) contract right away
Excellent salary and working benefits
Company car / good mobility scheme
25 holiday days with the possibility to take up to 5 more
Generous bonus scheme
Possibility to take a sabbatical after 3 years of employment
IG&H facilitates a Healthy Human program, where you get guidance with all adjustments in life, such as having a child or being a caregiver to a sick family member
Possibility to work parttime (32 hours), at least 4 days a week
Great opportunity to make an active contribution to the further growth of the organization
And more, which we would love to elaborate on




WHY IG&H?

IG&H is transforming leading companies across the Health, Retail and Finance sectors. Together with our world-class technology partners, we help our clients move forward and stay relevant. With insightful advice, great design and unrivalled digital platforms. Our exceptional results come from successfully aligning people, business and technology. With over 350 talented colleagues on board, people who genuinely embrace change and challenges, we’ve created a unique high-daring, high-caring culture. Attracting extraordinary people and inspiring them to push the boundaries for themselves and our clients.




So what does that mean for you?

On the one hand, if this vacancy is right for you, then this is a Great Place To Work, with super happy employees and clients (NPS > 60). Furthermore, we’re hitting double-digit growth and have our sights firmly set on continued international expansion. We’re still just embarking on this exciting adventure. Why not be part of it?




Will you be our new (Junior) Data Scientist?

You can apply directly via the apply button. We hope to meet you soon!




We want our employees to reflect the diversity of society. We work together with a remarkable mix of talents, personalities and cultures. IG&H is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to national origin, race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability or age. We care about individuality, but most importantly, we share the pride of our collective achievements and a Great Place to Work.




Are you a representative from a recruitment or outsourcing agency? We appreciate your interest, but kindly ask to not contact us regarding this job. We work with preferred suppliers if needed.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
DATA SCIENTIST / ANALYST - Utrecht area - Hybrid way of working - 12 months with a possibility for an extension!







*Only candidates living in the Netherlands are considered for this position*




Are you a Data Scientist or Analyst with experience in Python and PySpark? If so, this opportunity might be perfect for you!




Amoria Bond is currently seeking multiple Data Scientists and Analysts with expertise in Python and PySpark to join our key clients in the Utrecht area. In this role, you will help the team perform, execute, and excel in their tasks.




The ideal candidate will have expertise in:

Data Analytics
Python
PySpark
Azure (Preferred)
Dutch speaking




There are two distinct roles available. In addition to the basic requirements listed above, we are looking for candidates interested in:




Business/Stakeholder-focused Role: Ideal candidates will have experience in business knowledge and stakeholder management.
Technical Hands-on Role: Ideal candidates will focus on back-end analysis; stakeholder management is not required.







Are you the Data Scientist/Analyst that we are looking for? Send your CV and contact details to meel.polkki@amoriabond.com and I will contact you as soon as I can!




We will endeavour to respond to your application ASAP. However, there may be times when it is not possible to reply to all applications, due to high volumes of enquiries. This is sometimes the case for unsuccessful applications to one of our vacancies. We apologise for this and can reassure you that we will keep your details and contact you in the future should any suitable positions arise.




Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Middle / Senior)
HTML:
Toloka AI is a global tech company that offers end-to-end AI solutions based on the effective combination of Crowd+ML+Expert+Tech Platform. Our solutions are powered by the most diverse global crowd from 100+ countries speaking 40+ languages.


We bring together experts from all over the world to form our growing team of more than 200 people. Our team is globally distributed and works from several locations, including the USA, the Netherlands, Israel, Czech Republic, Serbia, and more. Working at Toloka unlocks the door to being able to work on global projects and our commitment to personal and professional growth.


We need an experienced and vigorous Machine Learning Engineer who will get the job done and enrich our team with knowledge, expertise, and experience.


Projects examples


  • Development of SFT data quality metrics and analysis of their impact on model performance;
  • Training models and develop tools for automating labeling for RLHF and Evaluation, including fact-checking, logical correctness, and AI-generated detection;
  • Researching approaches for synthetic data generation and building automatic pipelines.


Responsibilities


  • Work with state-of-the-art deep learning models and combine them with human input;
  • Reproduce scientific papers, conduct experiments and analyze results;
  • Develop prototypes and test their effectiveness in practice;
  • Evaluate model performance and implement data quality metrics.


Qualifications


  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, machine learning, data science, or a related field;
  • 3+ year of industry experience in machine learning, data science, or a related field;
  • Strong engineering skills and proficiency in Python, SQL, and ML tools/libraries;
  • Comprehensive knowledge of machine learning fundamentals;
  • Experience with deep learning models, especially in NLP or CV.


Preferred but not required


  • Experience with large language models or other generative AI technologies;
  • Proven track record in research activities;
  • Fluency in English.


What we can offer


  • Personal and career development: we support employee’s ambition for professional development and encourage them to implement their ideas in their projects;
  • Flexibility: we offer remote or hybrid employment. You will also design with your manager a workday that works best for you;
  • Paid parental leave + Annual vacation policy;
  • Transportation expenses reimbursement;
  • Meal allowance for every working day in the office;
  • Contributions to personal pension plan.

  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description:

Imagine a world where every interaction feels effortless. That's what we strive for at CM.com.

We're a global tech company, publicly traded, and growing. You might already know us from those seamless SMS or WhatsApp messages you receive, the tickets you effortlessly grab for that upcoming festival, pay for anything with our payment solutions, or even through chatting with the helpful AI chatbot for support. We're passionate about empowering businesses to deliver incredible experiences to their users, designed to revolutionize how businesses connect with their customers.

Although our work may be highly technical, our people are the spark that ignites innovation. We're a collective of ambitious minds, fueled by a passion for technology and a dedication to making a difference.

Since 1999, our philosophy has remained the same: “Do what you love, do what you’re good at, and contribute”.

What You Will Do

To achieve this mission, we are looking for a Data Scientist for our Inspire Team, you'll be tasked with analyzing consumer data from consumer brands you encounter on a daily basis. By personalizing every consumer connection, you ensure that their buyer journey will be enhanced. You become part ofmotivated, and high-performing project teams to develop machine learning models that are ready for production. Together with us, you work on our end-to-end solutions to make the most impact on our clients!

We are gurus in Consumer AI: with our Artificial Intelligence, we ensure that companies can offer a personalized service to every single consumer. We analyze customer behavior, predict individual customer needs, and turn these predictions into actions. This way, we ensure the consumer receives a personalized and relevant experience at every point in the customer journey. We act from an ethical viewpoint: not just the algorithms themselves, but the moral compass of our employees ensure that we make impact in the right way.

Requirements:

You connect with us, if you have:


Master's degree in a technical study (e.g. Econometrics, AI, Computer Science, Data Science);
Preferably you have some side experience in a similiair role during an internship or side job;
You love to build machine learning models and know how to handle big data;
Experiencein working with SQL and Python, and have affinity with working in a cloud environment (e.g. Azure);
You think outside the box, try to find practical solutions in the most creative ways, and love to share your innovative ideas with your colleagues to achieve great results.
You are fluent in Dutch and English, both written and spoken;
You live in travel distance of our Tilburg, Breda or Amsterdam office and are available for a full-time position.


As a person


You like to work in a dynamic environment while performing in various client-project teams;
You are eager to learn, show great commitment, and get energized from developing solutions together with your ambitious colleagues;
You get energized from guiding consumers in their buying journey, making sure they get attached to the right product or service.


Benefits of working @CM.com

Your journey starts with the 3-day Global Onboarding at our Breda HQ. It's your fast track to CM.com awesomeness. Dive deep into our culture, connect with fellow game-changers, and get ready to join informative sessions, practical workshops, and great fun.

As a Club Member, you'll unlock a world of incredible benefits:


Fuel your mind: Daily healthy lunches and snacks to keep you energized.
Effortless commutes: Shuttle mobility cards and company cars get you where you need to be.
Invest in your future: A solid pension plan.
Take your time off: 25 vacation days with the option to buy 10 more to provide peace of mind.
Own your success: Become a shareholder with our Employee Share Purchase Program.
Level up your skills: Udemy, CM Academy, and exclusive Meetups with thought leaders to ensure you're always learning and growing.
Life's a party: Weekly drinks, board game nights, karaoke throwdowns, yearly ski trip, and more! We have something for everyone.


Here, diversity is our superpower. We celebrate every member, regardless of age, background, or beliefs. At CM.com, everyone gets VIP access – because together, we rock!

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Ben jij een ervaren Data Scientist die gedreven is om waardevolle inzichten te kunnen creëren uit complexe datasets? Wil je deel uitmaken van een leuk team met getalenteerde en gepassioneerde experts, werken aan uitdagende projecten waarbij geavanceerde analysetechnieken worden toegepast om oplossingen te vinden voor complexe vraagstukken?

Dan zoeken wij jou:


Wat ga je doen:

  • Verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van grote en complexe datasets met behulp van geavanceerde statistische en machine learning technieken.
  • Identificeren van patronen, trends en relaties in de data om waardevolle inzichten en voorspellende modellen te ontwikkelen.
  • Werken aan uiteenlopende projecten, variërend van het optimaliseren van bedrijfsprocessen tot het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen voor het voorspellen van klantgedrag.
  • Vertalen van zakelijke vraagstukken naar data-analysevereisten en het leveren van innovatieve oplossingen.
  • Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams, waaronder data engineers, softwareontwikkelaars en business analisten, om data science-oplossingen te ontwikkelen en implementeren.
  • Communiceren van complexe analyseresultaten en technische concepten naar niet-technische stakeholders in een begrijpelijke en overtuigende manier.



Wat verwachten we:

  • Een afgeronde masteropleiding of PhD in een relevant vakgebied, zoals Data Science, Statistiek, Wiskunde of Computer Science.
  • Aantoonbare ervaring met het uitvoeren van data-analyseprojecten en het toepassen van statistische en machine learning technieken.
  • Uitgebreide kennis van programmeertalen zoals Python, R of SQL, en ervaring met data science-tools en -frameworks zoals TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn of Azure stack.
  • Sterke analytische en probleemoplossende vaardigheden, met het vermogen om complexe vraagstukken te doorgronden en innovatieve oplossingen te ontwikkelen.
  • Ervaring met het werken met grote datasets en kennis van data cleaning, pre-processing en feature engineering.
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk, om technische concepten en analyseresultaten duidelijk over te brengen aan verschillende stakeholders.
  • Teamgeest en het vermogen om effectief samen te werken in multidisciplinaire teams.


Wat krijg je:

  • Uitdagende functie binnen een dynamisch en innovatief bedrijf;
  • Marktconform salaris en goede arbeidsvoorwaarden;
  • Goede pensioensregeling;
  • Uitdagende werkomgeving;
  • Professioneel en gezellig team (samenwerking, kennisdeling en veel team-uitjes);
  • Nieuw kantoor in Den Haag (elke donderdag borrel);
  • Werk hybride, thuis en op kantoor;
  • OV-vrij abonnement of lease auto;
  • Ruimte voor persoonlijke groei (opleidingsbudget + mogelijkheid om certificaten te behalen);
  • 29 vakantiedagen.


Note: We ondersteunen geen Visa of Work Permit aanvragen

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Looking for a role that blends Software Engineering with Machine Learning?




Want to work in a super modern stack on a real-time, global product?




Our client's looking for a Python Engineer to join the team with Machine learning experience.




You'll focus on building API's and deploying the models created by scientists into production. The role is therefore a mix of a Python Engineer & Machine Learning Engineer, otherwise known as MLOps.




The product is extremely innovative, complex and used all over the world!




Essential Experience




Strong Python experience writing API's
Machine learning experience - specifically deploying models created by Data Scientists into production (MLOps)
Docker
Relational / Non-Relational Databases
Public cloud
At least 2 years experience




Beneficial Experience




Kubernetes
Big Data experience
MongoDB
Event Driven Architecture
Real-time experience
Airflow




Start - Next 2-3 months




Salary - 70-85K including the 8% holiday allowance




Hybrid - 2 days a week working at the office in Amsterdam (Tuesday & Thursday)




This company can provide visa sponsorship and 30%




NOTE - You must already be in the Netherlands




Interested to know more information - apply now!

Title: Data Scientist / Data Expert
Description:
About Us

COMPUTD, a progressive start-up in Geleen, is a leader in Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Data Science. Our goal is to be the definitive data science authority, leading clients towards advanced, data-centric solutions. As we expand our global reach, we seek motivated and experienced professionals to join our evolving team.




Profile

We are searching for a Data Scientist/Data Expert, proficient in AI. This role suits individuals who excel in both independent initiatives and collaborative projects. At COMPUTD, you will engage in a variety of tasks, from in-depth internal development to dynamic client-facing roles, contributing significantly to our AI and data science endeavors.




Responsibilities

Develop, implement, and refine complex algorithms in AI, with an emphasis on delivering high-quality solutions. NLP knowledge is a plus.
Employ advanced machine learning techniques to solve intricate data problems.
Design, prototype, and rigorously test AI models, emphasizing their scalability and efficiency.
Address sophisticated data quality and architectural challenges.
Work collaboratively with our team and directly with clients, articulating complex AI concepts effectively.
Preference for candidates willing to regularly commute to our Geleen office for better team collaboration and client interaction.




Who Are You?

Holder of a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field, with several years of relevant experience.
A track record in machine learning and AI, with the ability to handle complex projects independently.
A problem-solver with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to excellence.
A collaborative team player, adaptable to different team sizes and dynamics, with the ability to mentor junior team members.
Continuously seeking to develop skills and expertise.
An effective communicator in English; Dutch or German is advantageous.
Proficient in database architectures, programming languages, and advanced project development methodologies.
Authorized to work in the EU and capable of regular commutes to our office in Geleen.




Why Work for Us?

Be involved in diverse, cutting-edge international AI projects.
Collaborate with an expert and diverse team.
Develop and implement impactful, intelligent solutions across various AI domains.
Focus on continuous personal and professional development in AI and data science.
Thrive in a dynamic, team-oriented start-up environment.
Engage in team-building activities and a positive work atmosphere.




What do we offer?

A competitive salary
A 10% pension contribution of your pensionable salary, fully funded by COMPUTD.
23 cents a kilometre reimbursement for your daily commute (up to a maximum of €250)
30 Vacation Days
€300 quarterly self-development credit







Technologies We Use:

Python, R
Azure, AWS, Databricks
SQL, and other database query languages
PowerBI, Dash, and other data visualization tools
Version control systems like Git




Join Our Team

If you are passionate about AI and data science and seek a role where you can make an impact, we encourage you to apply. Send your CV and a cover letter to jobs@computd.nl, or apply via LinkedIn’s EasyApply.




Note: Direct applications only. We are particularly interested in candidates who can embrace a hybrid working model, including regular office commutes.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Remote within in the EU - 12 Month Initial Contract




Our client is a leading Fintech company in Europe, and they are looking to add mid-senior level Machine Learning Engineers to their growing team. They are embarking on a large scale development project and looking to scale their project team with the addition of 3 engineers for an initial 12 Month contract with further extensions likely as it is a multi year project.




What You'll Work With:

Python, MLOps, PyTorch, MLflow, Tensorflow, Pandas, AWS, Azure, Scikit




You will be playing a pivotal role in the development of data science features alongside data engineering. In this role, you'll be responsible for designing ML pipelines, implementing algorithms to address dataset complexities, and spearheading the creation of a groundbreaking financial platform. You'll be an essential member of a dynamic and skilled team within a high-energy environment.




Responsibilities:

Develop forecasting and prediction models from inception to production-ready status, starting from proof of concept
Collaborate closely with product, research, and development teams to ensure product alignment and enhance product efficiency
Play a pivotal role in the research phase, identifying optimal market solutions for defined business challenges
Deploy machine learning models into production environments, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency
Offer guidance and expertise to both the R&D and product teams




Requirements:

3+ years' experience as a Senior Software Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, Data Engineer with a key focus on Machine Learning
5+ in hands-on engineering roles with Python
3+ years of experience in SQL, including proficiency in complex queries such as aggregations and analysis
Exposure to working on cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Expertise in machine learning algorithms and techniques, including supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, and reinforcement learning
Experience with classical machine learning models and techniques
Solid understanding of data engineering concepts, including data preprocessing, feature engineering, and ETL processes
Familiarity with MLOps and ML pipeline tools, along with experience with scientific libraries




Who We Want To Speak With:

Independent, self-motivated, and inherently curious Engineers, passionate about creative problem-solving and critical thinking
A collaborative team player with exceptional communication skills




If this position would be of interest to you or anyone within your network please apply through the link or send an updated resume to adam@umatr.io for consideration.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Data & AI
Description:
Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Data & AI

Job Location: The Hague, Netherlands

Job Type: Permanent/ Onsite







JD: Roles & responsibilities




You must possess

Possess 13–17 years of hands-on work experience as a Data Scientist.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with a flair for compelling storytelling.
Strong communication and presentation skills to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Expertise in various machine learning algorithms, techniques, including deep learning and LLMs.
Knowledge of big data technologies and experience on cloud platforms like AWS or Azure as well as managing large datasets.
Experience in MLOps practices and deploying machine learning models into production environments.
Project management abilities to lead data science initiatives from conception to completion.
Critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities to address unforeseen challenges in data science projects.
Mentoring and leadership skills to guide junior team members and foster a data-driven culture.
Ability to contribute to business strategy by aligning data science initiatives with organisational goals.
Ability to work with real-time data and implement real-time analytics.
Experience applying various machine learning techniques to telecom-specific use cases.
Engage with business and technology stakeholders, collect necessary information, comprehend client expectations, clarify details through workshops, and propose and discuss optimal solutions.
Work closely with the pre-sales, account, and sales teams, providing support throughout all phases of Data & AI deal pursuits and expand existing projects.




Good to have.

Possess a Bachelor or Masters degree data science, statistics, computer science, or a related quantitative field.
Engage with clients effectively and play a key role in achieving successful outcomes for clients.
Strong understanding of telecom industry domain knowledge, including communication networks, user behaviour analysis, and network optimisation.
Leadership abilities, strategic thinking, and experience managing data science teams and projects are crucial.
Demonstrate continuous learning to stay updated with the latest advancements in Data & AI.
Demonstrated expertise in designing, developing, and implementing state-of-the-art GenAI applications.
A good understanding of Ethical AI and AI Governance.
Contribute to the development of solutions and automation accelerators, and mentor emerging Data & AI talent.
Familiarity with the business landscape throughout Europe.
Willing to travel up to 10 to 20% of the time, primarily within the NL and sometimes within Europe.




What We Offer.

An entrepreneurial environment, fostering a highly team-oriented culture, with the opportunity to shape the future of Hexaware's Data & AI practice.
Competitive compensation, which includes a base salary and variable pay that is dependent on both individual and company performance.
You will work with the best minds on cutting-edge data, analytics, and AI themes (e.g., Generative AI) that have a real impact across industries.
We foster a performance-driven culture that simultaneously prioritises teamwork and collaboration, including regular company-wide events.
Flexible working arrangements, provided that all commitments to both clients and the company are fulfilled.
High emphasis on learning and personal development, with generous support from Hexaware in terms of time and budget allocation.
We foster a diverse and inclusive culture where you're valued for your individuality and encouraged to express your unique perspectives.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Can you tackle some of the hardest data science challenges to solve pressing customer needs?




We are looking for a talented and collaborative colleague to join our ranks!

At Elsevier, we help the world of research to make high-value decisions with confidence through a rich portfolio of services and products such as Scopus, Pure, and SciVal. The high-quality connected data and insights that these products provide come from our Research Data Platform (RDP), the data powerhouse of Elsevier’s analytics business. We are looking for a senior data scientist to join our RDP team and further advance our entity extraction and linking capabilities.







About our Team




In RDP, we are describing the world of scientific research as accurately as possible by profiling a wide range of entities, from People and Organizations to research artefacts such as Publications and Grants all the way to topics and concepts that characterize what research is about. Our entity-linking and disambiguation systems integrate data from a diverse set of sources that include millions of research articles to demonstrate market leading performance. The RDP team is large, full of talented people, and highly cross-functional and collaborative: As a data scientist, you will be working together with software engineers, analysts, product managers, and architects on selected areas of focus, and be part of the wider RDP Data Science team.




About the Role




Your focus will be on improving the quality of our entity extraction and linking capabilities around funding-related data to power Elsevier’s products. You will work closely with our engineers, architects, product managers and other data scientists within the Funding domain. You continually improve our best-in-class disambiguation systems and integrate data from a diverse set of data sources that include millions of research artefacts. You maintain and develop systems and models that scale well.




Responsibilities




Being passionate about the possibilities of creating value for customers by interconnecting data and improving the quality and richness of data at scale;
Working with others as part of a team to achieve a common goal, and you are eager to contribute and put your ideas across;
Willing to learn new things and come up with practical solutions to technical challenges.




Requirements




Have hands-on experience developing (components of) large scale data science solutions;
Have a formal qualification in computer science, computational linguistics, data science, machine learning, or other quantitative disciplines;
Have demonstrable coding skills in Python;
Have knowledge of applying machine learning techniques;
Experience with databases, NoSQL data stores and knowledge of SQL.




Work in a way that works for you




We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organisation. We offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, shared parental leave, study assistance and sabbaticals, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and your long-term goals.




• Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive




Working for you




We know that your well-being and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:




• Dutch Share Purchase Plan

• Annual Profit Share Bonus

• Comprehensive Pension Plan

• Home, office or commuting allowance

• Generous vacation entitlement and option for sabbatical leave

• Maternity, Paternity, Adoption and Family Care leave

• Flexible working hours

• Personal Choice budget

• Variety of online training courses and career roadshows

• Wellbeing programs and gym facility in the office

• Internal communities and networks

• Various employee discounts

• Recruitment introduction reward

• Work from anywhere

• Employee Assistance Program (global)

• Annual Event




About the Business




A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world’s grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.

Show more
