Title: Senior Data Scientist - Data & AI
Description:
Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Data & AI

Job Location: The Hague, Netherlands

Job Type: Permanent/ Onsite







JD: Roles & responsibilities




You must possess

Possess 13–17 years of hands-on work experience as a Data Scientist.
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills, with a flair for compelling storytelling.
Strong communication and presentation skills to convey complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, and SQL.
Expertise in various machine learning algorithms, techniques, including deep learning and LLMs.
Knowledge of big data technologies and experience on cloud platforms like AWS or Azure as well as managing large datasets.
Experience in MLOps practices and deploying machine learning models into production environments.
Project management abilities to lead data science initiatives from conception to completion.
Critical thinking and problem-solving capabilities to address unforeseen challenges in data science projects.
Mentoring and leadership skills to guide junior team members and foster a data-driven culture.
Ability to contribute to business strategy by aligning data science initiatives with organisational goals.
Ability to work with real-time data and implement real-time analytics.
Experience applying various machine learning techniques to telecom-specific use cases.
Engage with business and technology stakeholders, collect necessary information, comprehend client expectations, clarify details through workshops, and propose and discuss optimal solutions.
Work closely with the pre-sales, account, and sales teams, providing support throughout all phases of Data & AI deal pursuits and expand existing projects.




Good to have.

Possess a Bachelor or Masters degree data science, statistics, computer science, or a related quantitative field.
Engage with clients effectively and play a key role in achieving successful outcomes for clients.
Strong understanding of telecom industry domain knowledge, including communication networks, user behaviour analysis, and network optimisation.
Leadership abilities, strategic thinking, and experience managing data science teams and projects are crucial.
Demonstrate continuous learning to stay updated with the latest advancements in Data & AI.
Demonstrated expertise in designing, developing, and implementing state-of-the-art GenAI applications.
A good understanding of Ethical AI and AI Governance.
Contribute to the development of solutions and automation accelerators, and mentor emerging Data & AI talent.
Familiarity with the business landscape throughout Europe.
Willing to travel up to 10 to 20% of the time, primarily within the NL and sometimes within Europe.




What We Offer.

An entrepreneurial environment, fostering a highly team-oriented culture, with the opportunity to shape the future of Hexaware's Data & AI practice.
Competitive compensation, which includes a base salary and variable pay that is dependent on both individual and company performance.
You will work with the best minds on cutting-edge data, analytics, and AI themes (e.g., Generative AI) that have a real impact across industries.
We foster a performance-driven culture that simultaneously prioritises teamwork and collaboration, including regular company-wide events.
Flexible working arrangements, provided that all commitments to both clients and the company are fulfilled.
High emphasis on learning and personal development, with generous support from Hexaware in terms of time and budget allocation.
We foster a diverse and inclusive culture where you're valued for your individuality and encouraged to express your unique perspectives.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - AI team
Description:
In this position, you will join our AI team! The team is focused on building machine learning solutions that directly power exciting new product features such as turning messy product data into structured attributes, categorizing products, and removing the background of product images.

You will get to take advantage of the latest breakthroughs in machine learning, such as large language models.

The team does a mix of experimentation and implementation work, resulting in a varied workload where there is ample room for creativity.

Your challenges:


Develop features end-to-end
Lead and deliver projects together with our product and engineering teams
Evaluate new open-source models for their suitability for our use cases
Scale up our model-serving infrastructure
Maintain our machine learning infrastructure using both internal and external tools
Leverage our proprietary training data



Who are you?


You are a software engineer with approximately 2 to 3 years of experience, and you have affinity with machine learning.
You enjoy developing and improving ML features, and you can take them from prototype to production.
You are interested in learning and applying both established and new techniques, such as neural networks, deep learning, reinforcement learning, and are not afraid of trying to apply recent theoretical breakthroughs to practical problems.
You enjoy writing typed Python programs that leverage modern language features like e.g. data classes, generators, and decorators where it makes sense to do so.
You like working in a team, and to take ownership of your projects.
High engineering standards: do you like to leave your code cleaner than you found it? So do we!



Furthermore you fulfill the following requirements:


Excellent programming skills in Python
Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and concepts (supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, etc.)
Previous experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, or another machine learning framework
Familiarity with databases and data processing libraries (e.g. Postgres, Pandas/Polars)
Knowledge of Python libraries like FastAPI, Pydantic, asyncio, requests, SQLAlchemy
Good working knowledge of Linux, git, and the command-line
Committed to high engineering standards



Nice to have


Education in a relevant field or equivalent thinking level
Familiarity with cloud platforms and technologies (like e.g. GCP) for deploying machine learning models
Familiar with Nix for managing dependencies
Experience in developing distributed systems



Other Requirements


You already live in the Netherlands and can work from our Utrecht office 2 days a week.
You have EU citizenship or you already have a valid work permit for the Netherlands.
You are available minimum 32 hours a week



What Do We Offer


Gross salary of 4.790-5.605 euros per month based on your experience (based on 40 h/w)
Stock Appreciation Rights: eligible employees can financially profit from Channable’s success
Saving for old age - we provide an extra 5% of your monthly base salary
Company-wide bonus at end of the year
Are you going to become a parent? We think it is important that you spend time with your newborn. Enjoy 5 weeks of 100% paid partner leave.
26 vacation days + 2 reload days based on 40 hours, and on top of this; you are allowed to go for a 3-week-long workation and an extra 3 weeks if you're an expat living in the Netherlands!
To work in a beautiful historic and fully renovated office in the heart of Utrecht & with a flexible hybrid working policy of (minimum 2 days in the office).
Having flexible working hours means starting your day between 8.00 - 10.00 am
Since you can work from home for 3 days a week, we will provide home office supplies.
Once every 10 weeks, you can use your creativity during our internal Hackathon day.
A €1.000 annual Individual Learning & Development budget.
We want you to feel good - please feel free to use our discounted OneFit subscription.You also have free & anonymous access to the OpenUp platform and psychologists. This free service is also available to your family members.
Traveling to our office? No problem, we will take care of your travel costs.
Channaweekend (we go abroad in 2024 for a long weekend with all the colleagues from all over the world)
Additional working conditions like great lunch, massages, in-office bar (Channabar), parties, yoga lessons, sports teams, video games, and many more!



How can you introduce yourself to us?

Are you interested? Please apply by clicking on the "apply now" button below. Please send your application in English. If it's a match, Giordano will get in touch with you for an introduction call. After that, you'll be invited for interviews. We look forward to hearing from you as soon as possible!

Contact by job agencies and recruiters will not be appreciated. Each recruiter or headhunter who approaches us agrees with a donation of €250 for Make-A-Wish.

At Channable, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration and we believe in diverse and inclusive teams.
Show more
HTML:
In this position, you will join our AI team! The team is focused on building machine learning solutions that directly power exciting new product features such as turning messy product data into structured attributes, categorizing products, and removing the background of product images.

You will get to take advantage of the latest breakthroughs in machine learning, such as large language models.

The team does a mix of experimentation and implementation work, resulting in a varied workload where there is ample room for creativity.

Your challenges:

  • Develop features end-to-end
  • Lead and deliver projects together with our product and engineering teams
  • Evaluate new open-source models for their suitability for our use cases
  • Scale up our model-serving infrastructure
  • Maintain our machine learning infrastructure using both internal and external tools
  • Leverage our proprietary training data


Who are you?

  • You are a software engineer with approximately 2 to 3 years of experience, and you have affinity with machine learning.
  • You enjoy developing and improving ML features, and you can take them from prototype to production.
  • You are interested in learning and applying both established and new techniques, such as neural networks, deep learning, reinforcement learning, and are not afraid of trying to apply recent theoretical breakthroughs to practical problems.
  • You enjoy writing typed Python programs that leverage modern language features like e.g. data classes, generators, and decorators where it makes sense to do so.
  • You like working in a team, and to take ownership of your projects.
  • High engineering standards: do you like to leave your code cleaner than you found it? So do we!


Furthermore you fulfill the following requirements:

  • Excellent programming skills in Python
  • Solid understanding of machine learning algorithms and concepts (supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, etc.)
  • Previous experience with PyTorch, TensorFlow, or another machine learning framework
  • Familiarity with databases and data processing libraries (e.g. Postgres, Pandas/Polars)
  • Knowledge of Python libraries like FastAPI, Pydantic, asyncio, requests, SQLAlchemy
  • Good working knowledge of Linux, git, and the command-line
  • Committed to high engineering standards


Nice to have

  • Education in a relevant field or equivalent thinking level
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms and technologies (like e.g. GCP) for deploying machine learning models
  • Familiar with Nix for managing dependencies
  • Experience in developing distributed systems


Other Requirements

  • You already live in the Netherlands and can work from our Utrecht office 2 days a week.
  • You have EU citizenship or you already have a valid work permit for the Netherlands.
  • You are available minimum 32 hours a week


What Do We Offer

  • Gross salary of 4.790-5.605 euros per month based on your experience (based on 40 h/w)
  • Stock Appreciation Rights: eligible employees can financially profit from Channable’s success
  • Saving for old age - we provide an extra 5% of your monthly base salary
  • Company-wide bonus at end of the year
  • Are you going to become a parent? We think it is important that you spend time with your newborn. Enjoy 5 weeks of 100% paid partner leave.
  • 26 vacation days + 2 reload days based on 40 hours, and on top of this; you are allowed to go for a 3-week-long workation and an extra 3 weeks if you're an expat living in the Netherlands!
  • To work in a beautiful historic and fully renovated office in the heart of Utrecht & with a flexible hybrid working policy of (minimum 2 days in the office).
  • Having flexible working hours means starting your day between 8.00 - 10.00 am
  • Since you can work from home for 3 days a week, we will provide home office supplies.
  • Once every 10 weeks, you can use your creativity during our internal Hackathon day.
  • A €1.000 annual Individual Learning & Development budget.
  • We want you to feel good - please feel free to use our discounted OneFit subscription.You also have free & anonymous access to the OpenUp platform and psychologists. This free service is also available to your family members.
  • Traveling to our office? No problem, we will take care of your travel costs.
  • Channaweekend (we go abroad in 2024 for a long weekend with all the colleagues from all over the world)
  • Additional working conditions like great lunch, massages, in-office bar (Channabar), parties, yoga lessons, sports teams, video games, and many more!


How can you introduce yourself to us?

Are you interested? Please apply by clicking on the "apply now" button below. Please send your application in English. If it's a match, Giordano will get in touch with you for an introduction call. After that, you'll be invited for interviews. We look forward to hearing from you as soon as possible!

Contact by job agencies and recruiters will not be appreciated. Each recruiter or headhunter who approaches us agrees with a donation of €250 for Make-A-Wish.

At Channable, we strive to create and foster an environment of belonging and collaboration and we believe in diverse and inclusive teams.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Role: AI – Machine Learning Engineer

Employment Type: Freelance/Contract (6 months, with the possibility of extension)

Rate: Starting at €95 per hour

Location: Eindhoven, Netherlands (Hybrid or Remote)

Start Date: Immediate







Freelance Machine Learning Engineer - Netherlands

My client is currently seeking an experienced artificial intelligence engineer to join the revolution. The engineer will join an innovative team in developing and implementing cutting-edge artificial intelligence products. Responsibilities will include designing and constructing sophisticated machine learning models, as well as refining and updating existing systems. This is a 6-Month Contract with the possibility of extension.

Requirements:

Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, related field OR Minimum 3 years' experience
Experience with machine learning, deep learning, NLP, and computer vision
Proficiency in Python, and Java
Strong knowledge of AI frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team environment

Responsibilities:

Study and transform data science prototypes
Design machine learning systems
Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
Develop machine learning applications according to requirements




Other Requirements:

Based in the Netherlands
EU citizenship or valid work permit for the Netherlands

Interview slots actively available, apply now to be part of our innovative team. 🚀

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
LocationAmsterdam, NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23375Published13 days ago

We are looking for a talented Data Scientist to join one of our clients in Medical Devices. The ideal candidate will have experience in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling, with a passion for applying these skills to the medical device industry.

Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret complex medical data to derive meaningful insights.
Develop and implement machine learning models to improve device performance and patient outcomes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and execute data-driven projects.
Create data visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Stay updated on the latest advancements in data science, AI, and medical devices.



Qualifications


Master’s or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Proven experience in data science and machine learning.
Proficiency in Python, R, or similar programming languages.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.



Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Title: (Senior) Data Scientists - based in Luxembourg
Description:
The positions are based at our Luxembourg headquarters and require regular office presence. The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support.

The EIB, the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate - Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO) – Data & Information Solutions Department (DIS) - Data Management Division (DM) - Analytics & Reporting Solutions Unit (A&R) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, (Senior) Data Scientists*.

These are full-time positions at grade 5/6 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.


internal benchmark: (Senior) IT Applications Officer


Purpose

You want to be part of our AI innovation lab to build the future using cutting-edge technologies such as deep learning, natural language processing and computer vision. We are looking for excellent team spirit, proactive attitude, as well as a passion for data…. As a member of our lab, you will have the opportunity to promote the latest advancements in the AI industry and deliver AI-powered solutions across various business domains. You will also work with a diverse and talented team of researchers, engineers and analysts who share the same passion and enthusiasm.

Operating Network

You will report to the Head of Unit and work in close cooperation with other IT units and counterparties from all directorates using AI services and solutions. There will be a lot of interaction with key stakeholders such as software vendors, providers of outsourced services, peer groups, consultants in order to optimise service levels and stay abreast of best practice.

Accountabilities


Establish a governance framework with the user community to ensure an effective use of the AI solutions & services within the organisation. Monitor its applicability’s and propose improvements to maximize value.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business challenges and opportunities where AI solutions can provide strategic value within the banking domain.
Design and conduct experiments to validate model performance, accuracy, and robustness, ensuring the highest quality of AI solutions.
Analyse business specifications, implement and deploy machine learning models and AI algorithms to extract insights, enhance decision-making processes, and automate tasks in accordance with the IT policies.
Collaborate with other IT teams to integrate AI solutions seamlessly into existing IT landscape and processes.
Ensure compliance with regulatory guidelines such AI Act and data security standards while handling sensitive customer information.


Qualifications


University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in Data Science, Computer Science, Information Technology, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics, or related quantitative field
At least 5 years’ of IT professional experience with at least 2 years in building and deploying AI/ML/GenAI solutions
Python programming experience with machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, XGboost, Keras, Pytorch, Spacy or equivalent
Experience with SQL and NoSQL databases
Experience with implementation NLP and LLM based solutions using models like transformers, GPT 3.5,4 or Langchain or equivalent
Experience in Front-end development with Next.js, React is an advantage
In-depth understanding of machine learning techniques, probabilistic modelling, natural language processing
Knowledge of cloud technologies, such as Microsoft Azure Cloud, AWS or Databricks
Familiarity with banking and financial data structures, as well as an understanding of regulatory requirements and challenges within the industry would be an asset
Good knowledge of project management principles, methods, and practices
Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (*), with a good command of the other. Knowledge of other EU languages would be an advantage.


Competencies

Find out more about EIB core competencies here

(*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.

We are an equal opportunities employer, who believes that diversity is good for our people and our business. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation/identity, disability or neurodiversity.

Applicants with specific needs are encouraged to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.

By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.

Deadline for applications: This is an open campaign to consecutively fill open positions. The campaign will remain open until position is filled. Applications will be reviewed in order of receipt.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Informa PLC is a leading international events, intelligence and scholarly research group.

Our purpose is to champion the specialist. Through hundreds of powerful brands, we work with businesses and professionals in specialist markets, providing the connections, intelligence and opportunities that help customers grow, do business, make breakthroughs and take better informed decisions. Informa is listed on London Stock Exchange and a member of FTSE 100, with over 11,000 colleagues working in more than 30 countries.

Informa Markets is one of the largest pure-play providers of speciality business-to-business market access services in the world. We have the leading position in twelve distinct commercial marketplaces on a global basis. We help buyers and sellers grow their businesses in industries as diverse as pharmaceutical and food through to luxury yachts, fashion and beauty products. We connect, educate, and provide actionable insights across specialty commercial sectors.

And we do this through scale trade exhibitions as well as innovative digital market access services for B2B suppliers and buyers.

Now, by leveraging our unique first party market data, we have embarked upon an ambitious programme to expand the way that we assist these communities in uniquely powerful ways.

This role will involve working closely with brand-aligned product leads to consistently improve results for our data led initiatives within Food industry.

As an experienced Data Scientist, you will be at the forefront of driving data-centric decision-making to validate and qualify our product ideas and growth initiatives. Your expertise in building scalable data science solutions will play a pivotal role in optimizing our product strategies and fuelling our growth. This position offers an exciting opportunity to leverage data to drive value for our customers, both internal and external.



Job Description


As part of the Data & Analytics team within the Foods division of Informa Markets, develop analytical and machine learning models to deliver data products.
Own the full lifecycle of model development from ideation and data exploration, algorithm design and testing, algorithm development and deployment, to algorithm monitoring and tuning in production.
Collaborate with other data & analytics team members to develop and operationalize consistent approaches to experimentation and campaign measurement.
Be a master in multi-functional collaboration by developing deep relationships with key partners across the company and coordinating with working teams.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product Managers, marketing teams, sales teams, to develop data-driven hypotheses for new product ideas and growth initiatives.
Design and conduct experiments to evaluate the potential impact of these hypotheses on product performance and customer engagement.
Work towards identifying and identifying and monitoring success criteria to effectively forecast product growth and revenue.
Identify and evaluate external and third-party data sources that complement current or future use cases.
Support in integration of external data sources seamlessly into analytical workflows for predictive and other machine learning models
Adhere to data privacy and security protocols in handling sensitive information.


Qualifications


Educated to degree level or equivalent. Good to have masters/phd in Data Science.
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience as a Data Scientist building and deploying data products on one or more of NLP, Classification algorithms, Predictive models, recommender systems etc
Expertise in tools like Python, SQL, GIT, Sagemaker (or equivalent).
Must have superb quantitative reasoning and interpretation skills with strong ability to provide analysis-driven business insight and recommendations.
Good MLOps knowledge preferably using AWS stack.
Experience using advanced statistical techniques for experiment design (A/B and multi-cell testing) and causal inference methods for understanding business impact.
Experience building relationships with partners and stakeholders.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; ability to work well with peers and leaders across data, marketing, sales and engineering organizations.
Creative problem-solver who simplifies problems to their core elements.
B2B customer data experience a big plus.


Additional Information



Why work at Informa?

Employee experience is very important to us at Informa. On top of joining a supportive, diverse and ambitious team that welcomesall types of candidates.We are alsoflexiblewithdifferent working patternsandprioritize promotions internally.

Our benefits include:

Tailored development opportunities and on-demand access to thousands of courses on LinkedIn
Balance time in the office with time working remotely, feeling fully supported wherever you are
24days annual leave, 4 days for volunteering and a day off for your birthday!
The chance to work from (almost!) anywhere across the globe, four weeks a year
Competitive and rewarding benefits, tailored to each of our regions
Work with high quality specialist products
Bright and friendly staff who are all “expert’s experts” and additional training and development for helping you achieve your career aspiration
The chance to become an Informa shareholder, with extra rewards just for colleagues
Regular social events and networking opportunities

We know that sometimes the 'perfect candidate' doesn't exist, and that people can be put off applying for a job if they don't fit all the requirements. If you're excited about working for us and have most of the skills or experience we're looking for, please go ahead and apply. You could be just what we need! We believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Informa is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, or religious creed, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship, or other protected characteristics under federal, state or local law.

See how Informa handles your personal data when you apply for a jobhere.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

About AkzoNobel

Since 1792, we’ve been supplying the innovative paints and coatings that help to color people’s lives and protect what matters most. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and use our expertise to sustain and enhance the fabric of everyday life. Because we believe every surface is an opportunity. It’s what you’d expect from a pioneering and long-established paints company that’s dedicated to providing sustainable solutions and preserving the best of what we have today – while creating an even better tomorrow. Let’s paint the future together.

For more information please visit www.akzonobel.com

© 2024 Akzo Nobel N.V. All rights reserved.

Let's paint a picture of the role

The Data Scientist supports Internal Audit in its strategy to transform into a data driven function and reports into to Senior Audit manager in charge of Data & Analytics. The data scientist enables value-added insights via development and execution of data analytics and data visualizations to support the global internal audit function. The Data Scientist role is expected to also join some audits as auditor, to experience how audits are performed and to help identifying improvement areas in utilizing data.

Responsibilities

  • Supports internal audit in identifying risk areas, planning, audits and review of controls testing using different Data Analytical tools and techniques;
  • Translates requirements from Internal audit in obtaining an understanding of business data and translate into useable analytics/insights;
  • Obtains the necessary data (and tools) to identify, design and develop insights;
  • Designs and develops advanced risk analytics to support (annual) audit plan;
  • Provide central, independent, common and easy access to key data for audit work;
  • Building strong relationships with stakeholders to support our data access and analytical capability to meet current and future requirements.
  • Supports the wider development and deployment of Data Analysis skills and competencies within AkzoNobel Internal Audit Function;
  • Provide internal audit staff training in use of data analytics tools / developments / techniques;
  • Update audit staff on new developments.

What do you need to have to be successful in this role?

Education Bachelor or master’s degree preferably in computer science, information technology, artificial intelligence, accounting, auditing, economic or business administration. Experience in audit profession is preferred. Experience

  • At least 5 years of data analytics experience ideally with experience in public accounting and/or in a large internal audit function and/or large or mid-sized international manufacturing company;
  • Understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation and excellent pattern recognition and predictive modeling skills;
  • Experience with data processing, database programming, data analytics and visualization tools (such as… ETL, SQL, Alteryx, IDEA, MS Power BI, Celonis, Databricks, MS Fabric…..).

Essential Skills

  • Professional skepticism, critical thinking, problem solving, analytic;
  • Analytical mindset, at ease with numbers and structured;
  • Sensitive to deadlines and budget constraints;
  • Effective time management skills;
  • Detail oriented;
  • Experience and able to work with different cultures, management styles;
  • Excellent communicator (presentation and communication skills);

What does AkzoNobel offer in return?

  • Above average number of annual holidays: 46 days.
  • Participation in the AkzoNobel pension plan.
  • Fixed bonus (CLA).
  • Travel expenses to and from work.
  • Opportunities for ongoing education and professional development.
  • Hybrid way of working.
  • Being part of events and networking platforms.
  • Paint with a discount.

More information on how to apply?

We welcome your online application via https://careers.akzonobel.com/. If you have questions about the role or interview process, please contact Merith de Bock at merith.debock@akzonobel.com. The recruitment process includes a selection of the best applications received through the system, interview rounds, and further steps. An online assessment and an employment screening are part of the selection process.

At AkzoNobel we are highly committed to ensuring an inclusive and respectful workplace where all employees can be their best self. We strive to embrace diversity in a context of tolerance. Our talent acquisition process plays an integral part in this journey, as setting the foundations for a diverse environment. For this reason we train and educate on the implications of our Unconscious Bias in order for our TA and hiring managers to be mindful of them and take corrective actions when applicable. In our organization, all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

Requisition ID: 41099

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About the job




✔ Are you a skilled machine learning engineer with a strong background in algorithm development and implementation?

✔ Are you looking for a role that combines hands-on technical work with consulting?

✔ Do you get satisfaction from seeing your models and algorithms being used in real-world applications?

✔ Do you enjoy being part of a team of experts who are passionate about machine learning and AI?




Then Xomnia is the place for you!




As a Machine Learning Engineer at Xomnia, your work for our clients will range from building data pipelines, to data exploration and modelling, to productionizing your models, and deploying them in a cloud environment. In the past our team has for example optimized the electricity grid for the future, ensured you have stable internet connection at home and worked together with LUMC on cancer research.

Together with the team, you will follow and set the best practices in modelling, programming, automation and CI / CD. At Xomnia, we value knowledge sharing and staying ahead of the curve in our constantly evolving field. We are looking for a team player who is dedicated to keep learning, and enjoys sharing knowledge with others.




Please note that for this position, we are looking for candidates that have the legal right to work in the Netherlands as we do not offer visa sponsorship.




What you will be working on




Collaborating with a cross-functional team at our client to understand business requirements and identify opportunities for applying machine learning
Designing and implementing machine learning models using a variety of techniques
Developing and maintaining machine learning pipelines, including data preprocessing, model training, evaluation, and deployment
Analyzing and interpreting results to inform decision-making and drive continuous improvement
Staying up-to-date with the latest machine learning techniques and technologies and apply them to business problems as appropriate
Following and setting best practices in modeling, programming, automation, and CI/CD




What you will need




A minimum of 3 years experience in a position such as a machine learning engineer, data scientist or data engineer, building scalable solutions to bring models to production
A degree in computer science, data science, artificial intelligence or similar
Experience in data wrangling and building data pipelines
Advanced knowledge of statistics and mathematics
Experience with building batch and streaming ETL pipelines
Excellent Software Engineering skills in Python (bonus: Scala or Java)
Experience with containerization (Docker), CI / CD and testing
Experience in working with at least one cloud environment (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Keen on sharing knowledge and being eager to keep developing yourself
Affinity for consulting and a drive to help clients
Fluency in Dutch is a mandatory criteria for this role




What we offer




Competitive salary
25 vacation days and the possibility of taking unpaid leave
Room to grow and develop yourself
Paid time for self development
Challenging assignments
Company laptop of your choice
Work from home package
A monthly in-depth training facilitated by colleagues or external trainers
Nice colleagues who besides work also like to undertake activities
Company trips and activities like the Xomnia WKD, ski trip, and weekly sports activities




About us




At Xomnia, we're passionate about helping organizations make data driven decisions, and we're looking for someone who shares that passion. If you're ready to use your analytics and data warehousing skills to help our clients achieve their goals and have the opportunity to work on diverse projects, then we want to hear from you!




We solve challenging data science and engineering projects, from start to finish. From developing an application for real-time fraud detection on Google Cloud Platform, to setting up a customized recommender engine in an existing Microsoft Azure environment - we develop and deploy tailor-made data science solutions.




Xomnia started in 2013 in one room in the heart of Amsterdam. These days we take up nearly two houses and it still feels like home. Like any family, we all feel comfortable just being ourselves.

Title: Data Scientist Sustainability
Description:
Job description: The role for you

We’re seeking a Data Scientist to shape cutting-edge analytical pipelines for in-depth sustainability insights. You’ll guide strategic interventions addressing land use change, deforestation, ecosystem conversion and -services, carbon stocks, biodiversity, water resources and climate risk. 

If you are passionate about the sustainable sourcing of agri-commodities have a knack for leveraging large and complex datasets to drive strategic decision-making; if you thrive on creativity, systemic thinking and global collaboration; and if you want to make an impact that matters, this role is for you! 

Job Description

As Data Scientist Sustainability you will be joining our global CRS team, playing a pivotal role in our mission to be the change for good food and a healthy future. By leveraging spatial analytics, in-house, and external datasets you will establish strategic analytical pipelines that help us find priority hotspots of intervention and guide or sustainability operations. You will help us to stay up to date with cutting-edge spatial datasets in our sustainability priority areas, put them into practice, and build capacity across all our more than 50 origination countries. You will integrate multiple data sources, use programming to build analytical pipelines, and capitalize on data visualization to bring your insights across various stakeholders. You will be applying multivariate statistics, inference statistical methods, predictive modelling, machine learning, spatial analysis, and mapping to diverse topics including land use change, deforestation, ecosystem conversion and -services, carbon stocks, biodiversity, water resources and climate risk.

Your work will directly influence our sustainable sourcing ambition and contribute to our commitment to sustainability.

Key Deliverables
Acting as the Product Owner of our current geospatial applications: being compliant with internal policies, regulations and frameworks such as EUDR, GHG Protocol and SBTi, SBTN, etc.
Maintain and update analytical pipelines, structured in, or linked to, cloud computing platforms (e.g. Google Earth Engine, Sentinel Hub, GCP)
Expand geo-spatial assessment capabilities: Design and implement new analytical pipelines for spatially explicit sustainability assessments; (e.g., integrating PRODES, MapBiomas, Tropical moist forest-TMF, biodiversity & climate risk layers, etc.) constantly researching and integrating state-of-the-art datasets
Customized sustainability assessments: Design and implement cross-cutting analytical pipelines to make customized and automated sustainability diagnosis reports at different aggregation levels (e.g., farmer, farmer-group, country, customer, etc.)
Strategic sustainability program design and advice delivery: leverage findings to identify priority intervention areas and give advice to build implementation strategies that deliver most impactful results across multiple cross-cutting sustainability dimensions
Capacity building for sustainable sourcing: You will liaise with our sustainability teams at origins to transfer knowledge and enhance team capabilities for implementing findings into our sustainable sourcing strategies and projects.
Organizational Effectiveness
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address business challenges
Effectively communicate results and insights to diverse audiences with various regional backgrounds
Support the Global Sustainability team; maintaining and keeping up to date current carbon monitoring, deforestation risk assessment, and applications used
Explore and study new cutting-edge and innovative data sources into sustainability assessment pipelines
Profile description: Requirements

To be successful in this role, you would need to have experience in, and knowledge of both the technical capabilities involved in Data Science, as well as the environmental aspects of agriculture. Particularly in the interface with land use change, land use modelling, deforestation, ecosystem conversion, carbon stocks, biodiversity, climate risk and water resources.

Minimum postgraduate level education (PhD preferable) in a related field 
5+ years of hands-on experience in (applied) research, multi-variate statistical analysis, data management, data integration and spatial analysis
Proficiency in data visualization packages, creating dynamic dashboard visualizations (e.g. Shiny Leaflet, GEE) and automated reporting
Proficiency in building automated reporting pipelines using multiple programming languages, such as R, Python, MySQL, and Javascript, and integrating large, complex and mixed datasets (e.g., spatially explicit, tabular, continuous, ordinal, categorical, etc.)
Experience with cloud computing and peer coding, such as Google Cloud, BigQuery, Google Earth Engine, Collab, and GitHub. With particular emphasis on handling geospatial datasets (raster and vector)
We offer: An opportunity awaits

In this role, you will have the exciting opportunity to collaborate with teams from more than 48 countries, encompassing diverse backgrounds and academic levels.You’ll work closely with our AtSource team and corporate reporting platforms, playing a pivotal role in aligning our sustainability efforts.This position can be filled either in our London office, or our Amsterdam office, as long as you contain a valid right to work for this location.

Title: Data Scientist - Controlling
Description:
At a glance

Ben jij dé hands-on vernieuwer en wil je net als wij, je met passie inzetten om data-analytics & innovatie binnen Controlling vorm te geven? ABN AMRO ontwikkelt zich in hoog tempo tot een data- en innovatie gedreven organisatie. De afgelopen decennia hebben we een schat aan informatie verzameld. Big data vol potentie voor verbetering op alle fronten. Daar liggen dus kansen om daarmee onze controllers en uiteindelijk ook de business lines en de bank vooruit te helpen. Hoe benutten we deze digitale goudmijn zo goed mogelijk? Daar hebben we jou voor nodig!

Your job

Het A&I werkt met een Databricks omgeving om data te ontsluiten en te vertalen naar strategische inzichten. Binnen dit team creëer jij strategische data inzichten en zorg je voor waarde creatie door gestructureerde en ongestructureerde (interne en externe) data grondig te exploreren. Jouw rol is het modeleren van de data zodat deze gebruikt kan worden ter besluitvorming.

In je werk:


ontsluit en modeleer je interne en externe data in de Databricks omgeving van het team.
vertaal je nieuwe project initiatieven naar data requirements en werkt deze met de data eigenaren verder uit.
onderhoud en ontwikkel je het datamodel van het team
ontwikkel je een data kwaliteitsmonitoring om de betrouwbaarheid van data inzichten vast te stellen.
ondersteun je bij de data science projecten van het team of voert deze (deels) zelf uit.



Working environment

Analytics & Innovation maakt onderdeel uit van Finance Controlling en is een multidisciplinair zelf- organiserend team. Onze missie is de Controlling en Finance organisatie meer data gedreven te maken. Hierbij hebben we drie aandachtgebieden:


Data insights: we creëren nieuwe inzichten voor de Controllers en de Business die zij bedienen. We identificeren nieuwe data bronnen, brengen Finance en Business data samen en passen (advanced) analytics technieken en modellen toe. Hiermee helpen we de transformatie van expert-based naar model-based besluitvorming.
Proces optimization: we zijn voortdurend op zoek naar verbetermogelijkheden van bestaande processen, binnen zowel Controlling als Finance breed. We kijken daarbij hoe nieuwe technologieën als GenAI/LLMs kunnen helpen bij het werk van onze collega’s.
People & skills: we adviseren het senior management en de rest van de organisatie over de mogelijkheden op het gebied van data. Daarnaast faciliteren we een trainingsprogramma om de analytics skills van onze collega’s te verbeteren.



Your profile


Je beheerst programmeertalen (Python, PySpark, SQL) voor het ontsluiten van data, het verkrijgen van inzichten en het modeleren van data middels Databricks.
Je hebt enkele jaren ervaring met betrekking tot het ontwikkelen en beheren van een datamodel.
Je bent ondernemend en geeft niet snel op. Veranderen gaat niet vanzelf, dus doorzettingsvermogen en de organisatie blijven challengen is een vereiste om succesvol te zijn.
Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden, zowel in woord als geschrift. Daarnaast kun je de resultaten van je werk op een heldere manier presenteren en weet je stakeholders te overtuigen.
Je bent gericht op samenwerken, vernieuwen en het bereiken van doelen.
Je bent pragmatisch en denkt probleemoplossend.



We are offering


Het bovenaan de pagina weergegeven bruto maandsalaris is op basis van een 36-urige werkweek, inclusief vakantiegeld en benefit budget.
Het benefit budget bedraagt 11% van je salaris. Als je in een maand geen aankopen of reserveringen doet in de Benefit Shop, krijg je over die maand een twaalfde deel van je benefit budget uitbetaald.
Vijf weken vakantie per jaar. Je hebt de mogelijkheid om vier weken per jaar bij te kopen.
Persoonlijk Ontwikkelbudget van € 1.000,- per jaar. Dit bedrag kun je opsparen tot € 3.000,-.
Mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken (in overleg met je team en afhankelijk van je functie).
Een ov-jaarabonnement met gratis openbaar vervoer in heel Nederland
Een uitstekende pensioenregeling.



Interested?

Solliciteer dan snel!

Equal opportunities for all

The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

Disclaimer external recruitment agencies

External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

Wij vragen


Samenwerkingsgerichtheid



Wij bieden


Analytische skills

  • Het bovenaan de pagina weergegeven bruto maandsalaris is op basis van een 36-urige werkweek, inclusief vakantiegeld en benefit budget.

  • Vijf weken vakantie per jaar. Je hebt de mogelijkheid om vier weken per jaar bij te kopen.
  • Persoonlijk Ontwikkelbudget van € 1.000,- per jaar. Dit bedrag kun je opsparen tot € 3.000,-.
  • Mogelijkheid tot thuiswerken (in overleg met je team en afhankelijk van je functie).
  • Een ov-jaarabonnement met gratis openbaar vervoer in heel Nederland
  • Een uitstekende pensioenregeling.

Title: Machine Learning engineer
Description:
LocationAmsterdam , NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23377Published13 days ago

We are looking for a talented Machine Learning Engineer to join one of our clients in Medical Devices. The ideal candidate will have experience in machine learning, AI, and software development, with a passion for applying these skills to the medical device industry.

Responsibilities


Design and develop machine learning models to enhance medical device performance.
Work with large datasets to train, test, and validate models.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate ML models into medical devices.
Monitor and optimize model performance in production.

Title: AI Data Scientist
Description:
AI Data Scientist bij Sogeti Nederland. Creëer innovatieve AI-oplossingen. Solliciteer nu en maak impact met je data-expertise!

Sogeti is een organisatie met een goede werksfeer en zo min mogelijk hiërarchische verhoudingen. Ga je bij ons als AI Data Scientist aan de slag? Dan kun je rekenen op honderden collega’s die klaarstaan om klanten te helpen, en ook elkaar graag een helpende hand bieden. Sogetisten gaan niet alleen voor goede resultaten, maar ook voor lol tijdens het werk. Deze snelgroeiende groep collega’s krijgt energie van hun vak en dat merk je op de werkvloer. Sogeti is een fijne werkgever en geeft jou de ruimte om de inhoud in te duiken!

Werken bij Sogeti

Als Data Scientist help je onze klanten vertrouwd te maken met verwerken van complexe data door middel van machine learning, data mining en deep learning technologieën. Je zet statistische modellen en voorspellende algoritmes in om verborgen patronen te onthullen. Daarbij ontwikkel je end-tot-end oplossingen om je werk te operationaliseren. Dit doe je samen met het Center of Excellence (CoE) van ons AI-team, of in directe samenwerking met de klant. Je creëert echte impact door middel van data.

Wie ben jij?

✔ Je hebt een masterdiploma (WO) ;

✔ Je hebt minimaal drie jaar werkervaring als Data Scientist of consultant in het werkveld van Data Science. Veel werkervaring met EDA en Machine Learning (Classification, Regression, Computer Vision, NLP, GANs) is belangrijk;

✔ Implementeren van technologieën aan de hand van de data science stack van Python (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow, Pytorch, Pandas, Numpy)? Geen probleem! ;

✔ Programmeertalen als R, Scala, C++ en Bash? Vertel me iets nieuws!

✔ Je bent in de wolken van Cloudoplossingingen (Azure, AWS, GCP) én kan agile werken? Ja!

✔ Je wilt samen met je team onze klanten naar ‘The Next Level’ brengen!

﻿Currently we are specific looking for professionals who speak fluently Dutch on C1 level.

Dit bieden wij jou

✔ Top Notch begeleiding bij al jouw werkzaamheden, ontwikkelingsvraagstukken, ambitie en uitdagingen!

✔ Onbeperkt ontwikkelbudget;

✔ Aantrekkelijke lease regeling met hybride en volledig elektrische auto’s;

✔ 26 vakantiedagen (mogelijkheid tot extra bijkopen)

✔ Goede pensioensregeling

✔ Groeien en genieten. Wij zorgen voor een cultuur waarin jij tot je recht komt.

✔ Vette events zoals Pizza avonden, ski-trips, game nights, movie nights.

﻿Weet jij nog iets? The sky is the limit.

You make technology work. Solliciteer nu!

Dus durf jij de uitdaging aan en wil jij meehelpen het succes van onze community verder uit te bouwen? Solliciteer dan direct!

﻿Een PES-screening maakt onderdeel uit van de onboarding van Sogeti.

﻿﻿Currently we are specific looking for professionals who speak fluently Dutch on C1 level.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
You make use of the latest technologies to safely and efficiently work with data and build production-grade environments. You work alongside our software engineers, security specialists, and business consultants to solve real-life challenges and provide the best possible service to our clients. As a Data Scientist/ AI Engineer, you are expected to work on three core aspects of building great AI solutions.




You work directly with our clients. You put yourself in their shoes and can explain complex artificial intelligence concepts to decision-makers.
You experiment and create prototypes and proofs of values to showcase the potential and limitations of a solution, both from a functional perspective, but also in terms of scalability, robustness, and return on investment.
You develop production-grade solutions and integrate them into our clients’ IT landscape. You understand software engineering best practices and write maintainable and modular code in an agile environment.
You take the lead within the projects you work on and you are also an ambassador for Mediaan Conclusion to current and prospective clients.
You coach and help junior data scientists grow within Mediaan Conclusion. You are also expected to actively grow your own expertise so that you can advise internal decision-makers.




WHO ARE YOU?




You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in either Data Science, Computer Science (+ experience with machine learning and data science), Natural/ Life Science or business/economics (+ experience with software development)
You have at least 5 years of relevant experience
You are a result-driven person who likes to solve problems
You are passionate about artificial intelligence and follow the latest news about the field
You are a real team player with experience working in large and small teams
You are willing to continually update your expertise and share your knowledge with your colleagues
Your communication skills are good as you will join a team of more than 15 data scientists
You have experience implementing machine learning and data science solutions for clients
You have experience working with different kinds of data from different sources
You have an affinity with data engineering and the experience working with data engineers
You have knowledge of programmatic data access such as SQL querying and ORMs
Experience using the Apache stack for Data Science is a plus
You have worked as a lead technical person in projects
You have strong programming knowledge and are aware of the best practices when it comes to developing software as a team (version control, scrum, CI/CD, etc)
You have a working permit in the EU
You are fluent in English. Knowledge of Dutch or German is considered a plus




WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME?




You work on challenging projects for (inter)national customers
You work with an international team, we have people from various nations & diverse environment
You create smart solutions using the state-of-art-technology on a daily basis
A fixed training budget? We don’t have that here at Mediaan Conclusion! You receive the training needed to be among the best in your field
Our clients range from small companies to large multinationals within various industries
You take part in internal and external skills/knowledge development
You get to play Nintendo Switch or ping pong during your lunch break
Awesome colleagues! You work with the best colleagues in your field
Our personal development and employment policies are always tailored-made. Do you want to work 95%? No problem! You choose what suits you best; more time, mobility, or cash?
Our head office in Heerlen is has gone under a complete makeover. Be prepared to work in a modern office




TECHNOLOGY STACK




Python/R (and ML/data science packages)
Docker
Azure/AWS
MongoDB/SQL/PostgreSQL
PowerBI/Dash
Git/CI/CD
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Do you want to make impact in our digital transformation within Supply Chain? We have an opportunity for you as a Data Scientist in our Global Digital Supply Chain team.

What We Ask


Can do mentality, hands-on, challenging the current state, growth mindset, persistent, emphatic
You have a broader view than just your position and you can identify with our purpose ‘Nourishing by Nature’.
You are customer focused and are able to act with speed and decisiveness to achieve the best results.
You take responsibility for your work and are continuously looking for new opportunities to make a change.
Bachelor/Master education or equivalent.
+4 years of experience as Data Scientis or in a similar role;
Experienced knowledge in other related field such as statistics, math, computer science, or economics.
Experience working with supply chain data and systems
Knowledge of statistical techniques and data visualization tools.
Analytical skills and proficiency in data wrangling and analysis tools such as SQL, PowerBI, and Excel
Conceptual thinker, focusing on next step, next gen
Internationally oriented and excellent communication and influencing skills;
Capabilities in Project/Portfolio Management
Capable of effective stakeholder management at various levels within RFC;



What We Offer


Unique company culture of Dutch heritage and international presence
We offer great work life balance, and competitive salary & benefits package so you can enjoy it
Workweek of 38 hours, competitive pension scheme, holiday allowance of 8%, end year allowance 4%, bonus scheme, flexible working hours and the ability to work from home.
Diverse training and mentoring programs to help you grow on your own professional journey
Exceptional support of cross disciplinary movement within the company to broaden your knowledge and growth paths
A friendly and informal working environment, yet professional team members as sparring partners
Autonomy and trust to create longer term impact that helps bring better nutrition to the world
Free cheese and milk at lunch in the central office, and barista coffee to help you go through your working days with a lot of joy



Vacancy Description

We are looking for an Enterprise Data scientist in our Digital Supply Chain Team. In this role you:


Develop digital tools for our business to enable improvements of our business
Operate in a challenging landscape of End-to-End Supply chain while tasked to optimize, simplify and standardize our processes by digitalization.
Use your analytical and statistical methods to identify patterns, trends, and insights from data that can be used to improve business performance.



You will be part of our Global Digital Supply Chain team, consisting of ten teammembers. The purpose of this team of to effectively leverage the power of digital capabilities and solutions to improve Service, Cost and Cash in the Global and End-to-End Supply Chain.

Staying true to who you really are, that is your starting point at FrieslandCampina. Because it is precisely by embracing our differences that we can grow together. We want to create a working environment that allows all employees to bring their best and authentic selves. If who we are suits you, but you're not sure if you're the best fit for the role, we still encourage you to apply so we can help you find the role that fits you best.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Qualogy zoekt een senior (minimaal 5 jaar werkervaring) data scientist.

Als data scientist bij Qualogy weet jij de veelheid aan data van onze klanten feilloos te interpreteren. Hiervoor zet je verschillende technieken in, waaronder Machine Learning. Je ontwikkelt ook algoritmes en software oplossingen op maat. En dat doe je voor onze innovatieve klanten: vanuit huis, kantoor of op locatie.




Qualogy vindt dat geweldige Data Scientists:

creatieve denkers zijn die altijd doorvragen.
nieuwe technologieën en wiskundige modellen snel weten te doorgronden.
met uitgekiende algoritmes complexe vraagstukken oplossen.
ervaring hebben met Machine Learning-technieken, databases en visualization tools.
duidelijke doelen stellen én uitdagingen en resultaten rapporteren.
ervaring hebben met programmeertalen, zoals Python, R en Hadoop Ecosystem.
communicatief sterk zijn: uitstekend in Nederlands en Engels.
hun data science-oplossingen continu naar een hoger plan willen tillen.
altijd de kwaliteit in het oog houden.




Ben jij de geweldige data scientist die wij zoeken of wil je er een worden? Dan zijn wij een match! Lees snel verder.




Qualogy staat voor kwaliteit en kennis. Naar onze klanten maar ook naar onze collega’s. We vinden het heel belangrijk dat jij je blijft ontwikkelen en voorop blijft lopen in jouw kennisgebied. Daarom krijg je bij ons een ruim ontwikkelbudget, zijn er volop kennissessies en maak je deel uit van onze actieve Java community. Samen met andere Javanen je vastbijten in ontwikkelingen en vraagstukken binnen Java. Door kennis te delen, blijf je groeien in je vakgebied. Door de aantrekkelijke bonusstructuur die wij hanteren, krijgt jouw al goede basissalaris, nog een flinke boost. Natuurlijk krijg je bij ons ook:

een salarisindicatie voor een een senior tussen de €4250– €6000.
ook een mooi bonussysteem o.b.v. jouw omzet, waarbij het percentage tussen de 15% en 30% ligt.
een werkgeversbijdrage van 4% van je bruto jaarsalaris inclusief vakantiegeld
een persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget van €2500,- per jaar
leaseauto met tankpas (ook in het buitenland)
30 vakantiedagen (28 standaard plus 2 extra Q-dagen)
de mogelijkheid hybride te werken
mobiel en laptop of een bring your own device regeling.




Last but not least, vinden we niet alleen samenwerken belangrijk maar ook samen leuke dingen doen. Binnen Qualogy worden veel events, meetings en activiteiten georganiseerd. We hebben een heel internationale en multiculturele mix van collega’s die we graag samenbrengen. We verwelkomen jou graag!




Over Qualogy

Al meer dan 25 jaar ontwikkelen we samen met toonaangevende klanten innovatieve IT-oplossingen. Qualogy telt nu zo'n 250+ collega's in Nederland met uiteenlopende specialiteiten en nationaliteiten. We zijn met onze diensten te vinden in Nederland en het Caribisch gebied. Vanuit onze kantoren in Rijswijk, Amsterdam en Paramaribo zijn wij altijd op zoek naar nieuwe talenten die zich bij ons willen aansluiten.

Een van de belangrijkste uitgangspunten van onze dienstverlening is: het inzetten van professionals met gedegen ervaring. Bij Qualogy werk je samen met gepassioneerde en ervaren IT-professionals die elkaar continu uitdagen en naar een hoger niveau tillen. In een échte kenniscultuur werk je aan innovatieve (internationale) projecten bij aansprekende klanten.




Ben je geïnteresseerd?

We drinken graag een kop koffie met je. Stuur je cv en motivatie naar career@qualogy.com of laat hieronder je gegevens achter. Je ontvangt binnen twee werkdagen een reactie van ons. Of neem direct contact met Dipak Hardwarsing op nummer +31610830089.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/div.)
Description:
Company Description

At Bosch, we shape the future by inventing high-quality technologies and services that spark enthusiasm and enrich people’s lives. Our promise to our associates is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and we inspire each other. Welcome to Bosch.

The grow platform GmbH is looking forward to your application!

Job Description

Our corporate start-up Bosch Software Flow (BSF) is looking for support! Our goal is to digitize the software release process together with our customers. For this purpose, we offer the software service Yaku, which has been specifically developed for highly regulated industries such as the automotive industry or the financial sector and enables the automation of software releases. At our company, you can expect an agile way of thinking and working in a modern working environment. Here, you have the opportunity to contribute your ideas and further develop yourself. Are you ready to make a difference?

Then become part of #TeamBSF and apply today! We look forward to receiving your application!


Model Development: You develop and deploy machine learning models for various business applications.
Data Pre-processing: You work with large structured and unstructured datasets for information retrieval tasks.
Model Training and Evaluation: You train models using appropriate algorithms, evaluate their performance, and iterate to improve accuracy and efficiency.
MLOps: You continuously deploy ML models into production environments and establish monitoring systems to ensure their performance and reliability.
Data Quality Validation: You design and implement data quality checks (e.g., Pandera, Great Expectations) to ensure data integrity and consistency.
Research and Innovation: You stay up to date with the latest advancements in machine learning engineering and AI and integrate new techniques and tools into the development process.


Qualifications


Experience and Know-How: You have at least 5 years of experience in agile software development where you used programming languages like Python, R, or Java. You have experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, or similar. Moreover, you have experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark), cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure), and Data pipeline tools (e.g., Dagster, Apache Airflow). You are familiar with software development and ML deployment practices, including version control (Git), CI/CD, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), and MLOps tools (e.g., MLFlow, DVC). You have a strong understanding of machine learning algorithms, statistical methods, and data structures.
Working practice: You have an independent, systematic and focused way of working practice. You are ability to work in a fast-paced, agile, and dynamic environment. Your hands-on mindset and intercultural skills characterize you.
Problem solving: You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Communication: You have excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Enthusiasm: You have passion for innovation and creating visually compelling experiences.
Languages: You are business fluent in English, other languages are welcome.


Additional Information

The contractual work location is Ludwigsburg.

You want to work remotely or part-time - we offer great opportunities for mobile working as well as different part-time models. Feel free to contact us.

Diversity and inclusion are not just trends for us but are firmly anchored in our corporate culture. Therefore, we welcome all applications, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, ethnic origin or sexual identity.

Here you get more information about Bosch Software Flow: Yaku by Bosch Software Flow (bosch-software-flow.com)

Bosch Software Flow is a trend-setting business model innovation financed by the grow platform GmbH, the Bosch incubator platform. Get more information here: What's in it for you? | grow platform

Need support during your application?

Nelly Ehrmann (Human Resources)

+49 711 811 48240

Need further information about the job?

Vadim Raskin (Functional Department)

+49 711 811 15965

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d)
Description:
Deine Herausforderung

Du begeisterst dich für ML und AI und willst mit uns gemeinsam die AI unserer Kunden gestalten? Du hast Spaß daran, in einem agilen Umfeld Akzente zu setzen und AI-Use-Cases für unsere Kunden produktive Realität werden zu lassen? Use Cases, bei denen sie nicht nur staunen, sondern die ihre Produktivität wirklich steigern? Du redest nicht nur über datengetriebenes Arbeiten, sondern lebst es jeden Tag vor? - Dann passt du zu uns!

Was dich erwartet


Arbeit im Team mit Data Scientists, Data Engineers und Platform Engineers
Beratung unserer Kunden bei Data Science, AI- und Analytics-Projekten
Unterstützung unserer Kunden beim Design und Aufbau ihrer Data Science- und AI Plattformen
Implementierung von AI und Machine Learning Services in die IT-Architekturen unserer Kunden
Management von Modellen mit MLOps-Tools und Frameworks
Durchführung von Workshops und Schulungen, wie z.B. Requirements-Workshops, Toolschulungen, etc.
Unterstützung bei Vertriebsaktivitäten, wie z.B. Kundenpräsentationen, PoCs, der Erstellung von Angeboten etc.


Dein Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium mit IT-Bezug, in Mathematik, Physik oder Statistik
Leidenschaft für Daten und praktische Erfahrung in AI und Softwareentwicklung, bevorzugt in den Bereichen Natural Language Processing und Deep Learning
Du bringst mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im produktiven Roll-Out von Enterprise-Scale AI, ML und LLM-Lösungen mit
Ebenso hast du Erfahrung in der Umsetzung von Projekten mit Frameworks wie TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Pandas oder ähnlichen
MLOps ist für dich kein Fremdwort, sondern gelebte Realität
Python und SQL sprichst du genauso sicher wie Englisch und Deutsch - in diesen Sprachen kommunizierst du auch komplexe technische Konzepte adressatengerecht
Du hast den Willen und die Fähigkeit, die Herausforderungen unserer Kunden zu Erfolgen werden zu lassen


Interessiert?

Wir freuen uns über deine Bewerbung (PDF) mit Angabe des Gehaltswunsches und möglichem Eintrittstermin. Jetzt online in unter 4 Minuten bewerben!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (m/w/d) / Remote möglich
Description:
Fashion und Lifestyle, 6.500 Mitarbeiter:innen, 13 Department Stores, Online-Shops in Deutschland, Polen, Österreich, Belgien, Luxemburg, Spanien, den Niederlanden und der Schweiz, über 2.000 Marken, 25 Restaurants & Confiserien, 15 erstklassige Services, drei Friseur-Salons und stets ein besonderes Einkaufserlebnis – das ist Breuninger. Ein Traditionsunternehmen, das internationale Wege geht, seine Ziele klar definiert und innovative Möglichkeiten schafft.

Gestalte mit uns die digitale Zukunft des E-Commerce bei Breuninger! Auf Basis modernster Methoden der Advanced Analytics findest Du mit uns aus Millionen internationaler Daten die relevanten Treiber für unser Business, um vieldimensionale Forecast-Modelle zu implementieren. Nutze den gestalterischen Freiraum für Deine eigene steile Lernkurve im Team.

Weitere spannende Informationen findest Du auch unter: B-Digital - Wir suchen kreative Vordenker:innen, die etwas bewegen wollen. (breuninger.com)

Deine Aufgaben

Data driven decision making – das ist was uns als Team Customer Analytics antreibt.


In Deiner Rolle bist Du sowohl für die Durchführung von Analysen als auch die Entwicklung, Implementierung und Betreuung neuer, sowie bestehender Data Science-Produkte zuständig. Der Fokus liegt hierbei auf unseren Kunden- und Transaktionsdaten.
Du verbringst einen signifikanten Teil Deiner Arbeitszeit damit Fragen zu beantworten wie „Welches Potential haben unsere Kund:innen?“, „Was zeichnet unsere Luxuskund:innen aus?“ und „Welche Kundengruppen können wir über das Einkaufverhalten ableiten?“
Der Austausch mit verschiedenen Stakeholdergruppen, sowohl in der Auftragserklärung als auch bei der Nutzbarmachung Deiner Ergebnisse, gehört zu Deinem Tagesgeschäft. Du übersetzt dabei Deine Erkenntnisse in belastbare Insights, durch die wir unsere Kund:innen noch besser verstehen und ansprechen können.
Darüber hinaus unterstützt Du unser Team bei der Pflege und Erweiterung eines Data Marts sowie unserer technischen Infrastruktur.



Dein Profil

Bringe Dich mit Deiner individuellen Persönlichkeit bei uns ein.


Du verfügst über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt oder hast Dein logisches Denken anderweitig geschult.
Du bringst verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse mit.
Du bringst Deine Erfahrung schnell auf die Straße und kannst uns nach Deiner Einarbeitung direkt weiterhelfen. Das zeigst Du uns durch erste Berufserfahrungen im Bereich Data Science und/oder Data Analytics, idealerweise im E-Commerce Umfeld.
Du hast einen kommunikativen Charakter und bist in der Lage komplexe Sachverhalte einfach und verständlich zu kommunizieren.
Wenn Du Rohdaten analysieren darfst, schlägt Dein Herz höher. Hierbei kannst Du SQL fließend bedienen.
Funktionale Programmierung in Python ist für Dich kein Neuland; zudem verfügst Du über Erfahrung im Umgang mit den gängigsten Python Data Science Paketen.
Vorerfahrungen in der Nutzung der Google Cloud Platform sind vorteilhaft, dasselbe gilt für Git, Gitlab CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes und Terraform.
Du bist ein:e Teamplayer:in, arbeitest eigenverantwortlich, ergebnisorientiert und lernst gerne dazu



Wir bieten

Bei uns erhältst Du die Möglichkeit, in einem modernen, agilen sowie wertschätzenden Umfeld zu arbeiten. Fühlst Du Dich angesprochen? Dann findest Du bei Breuninger ein Team, in dem Du Dich wohlfühlen und nachhaltig wirken kannst.


Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit betrieblicher Altersvorsorge und freiwilligen Sozialleistungen wie Urlaubs- und Weihnachtsgeld
30% Mitarbeiter:innenrabatt auf alle Produkte und Leistungen inkl. Gastronomie, Friseure etc.
Persönliche und fachliche Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten bis hin zum Führungskräfteentwicklungsprogramm
Maximale Flexibilität bei Urlaubstagen in Form von zusätzlichen, bezahlten Urlaubstagen durch Gehaltsumwandlung
Familienfreundliche Arbeitszeiten für DeineWork-Life-Balance
Corporate Benefits und attraktive Rabatte von bis zu 21.000 Unternehmen
Company Bike mittels Entgeltumwandlung günstig und unproblematisch leasen



Haben wir Dein Interesse geweckt?

Dann sollten wir uns schnell kennenlernen!

Bei Fragen steht Dir Dominic Bayer gerne jederzeit zur Verfügung.

Wir freuen uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Online Bewerbung mit Angabe Deiner Verfügbarkeit sowie Gehaltsvorstellung.
Show more
