Would you like to join us from the beginning of our AI venture as we build a new team that will bring the right AI tools to create business value?

Join us as we identify the AI models, we should configure to create a more effective business and ultimately make a difference to both people with intimate healthcare needs and healthcare professionals worldwide.

” Bringing your curiosity about AI and innovation to the table, you’ll get to work with the latest technology and make it come to life in an international company with a higher purpose ,” says AI Lead, Simon Buemann.

A new team dedicated to AI

Within Digital, Data and IT, you will be part of a new AI team. The team will be responsible for gathering and evaluating requirements for AI solutions from the entire business, creating roadmaps as well as identifying, configuring and developing the solutions into our setup.

“ This area has a lot of interest from stakeholders across the business. I am looking forward to working with brand new technology and contributing to innovation globally – and hopefully growing our team along the way ,” explains Simon.

Deliver ethical and amazing AI solutions

With your team, your aim will be to deliver AI solutions that are aligned with Coloplast’s strategic goals and provide measurable business value. Throughout your work, it will be a priority to gather new knowledge on AI and contribute to the continuous improvement of our methodologies and practices.

Specifically, you will be delivering on our prioritised AI use cases in our roadmap to enhance operational efficiency and innovation. This covers all phases from refining business needs, developing solutions and configuring and grounding pre-built AI models, to testing and validation and finally creating documentation and supporting business roll-out. This also entails

  • Collaborating with team members, vendors, and business stakeholders from inception to deployment, ensuring quality, timeliness, and alignment with the business requirements and expectations
  • Working with team members, other developers, and vendors to design, develop, test, and deploy AI solutions within Azure and other platforms that meet the technical and functional specifications
  • Ensuring that we implement sufficient test and documentation procedures
  • Collaborating with IT and software development teams to ensure seamless integration of AI capabilities
  • Monitoring and evaluating the performance and impact of the AI solutions, and providing recommendations for improvement and optimisation



Knowledge and understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications

In this role, you need good people skills to explain complex AI concepts and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences. Also, you have a strong sense of structure and quality, allowing you to really test our AI models and make sure we create the best and most ethical ones.

Finally, you enjoy learning, as AI is a constantly changing area, and we furthermore imagine that you

  • Hold a bachelor's degree or higher in Software Engineering, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or similar
  • Have experience in software development and an understanding of AI model integration
  • Are proficient in Azure and other cloud services, maybe with a track record of setting up AI models in these environments
  • Have programming experience writing clean maintainable code for instance in Python, C++, Java or other relevant coding languages
  • Have knowledge and an understanding of AI concepts, techniques, and applications, such as machine learning, deep learning, natural language processing, computer vision, etc.
  • Are fluent in English



Interested?

If you would like to know more about the position, please email AI Lead, Simon Buemann on dksibu@coloplast.com. We will take candidates into the recruitment process continuously, so do not hesitate to apply. This position will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found .

Pursuing an ambitious growth agenda, Coloplast develops and markets products and services that make life easier for people with intimate healthcare needs. Employing about 16.000 people and with products available in more than 143 countries, we are one of the world´s leading medical device companies. We are constantly growing our business and always looking for new ways to move forward – we explore, learn and look for new ways of doing things.

Coloplast is committed to being an inclusive organization, where people bring their differences to work each day, fulfil their potential and have a strong sense of belonging because – and not despite – of their differences. We therefore encourage all qualified candidates to apply regardless of gender, age, race, nationality, ethnicity, sexual orientation, religious belief or physical ability.

Visit us on Coloplast.com .

Watch the film. Follow us on LinkedIn . Like us on Facebook .

56937

Title: Data Scientist – Machine Learning and Computer Vision
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
FOSS Analytical A/S is looking for a talented and highly skilled data scientist with a strong background in machine learning and deep learning methods to drive the development our future imaging and spectroscopic solutions for food analysis.

This is an exciting opportunity, as you will have significant influence on FOSS’ future innovation opportunities. In a global world with a growing population, there is an ever-increasing demand for safer food and less food waste. Our solutions provide accurate measurements and analytics insights to optimize food production from raw materials to finished products, and ultimately a better global usage of limited resources.




Primary tasks

Your main responsibility will be to develop and evaluate new machine learning algorithms for our analytical instruments based on imaging and spectroscopy. You will work in a dedicated project team and be responsible for all steps of the data analysis. You will work in close collaboration with our software algorithm team, hardware team and marketing organization in taking the data analysis chain from concept to deployment and sales release.

Your responsibilities will be to:




Define the data needs for training machine learning models capable of fulfilling performance targets
Develop the algorithms and data pipelines
Design experiments to test the data analysis chain
Assist in understanding and translating customer requirements to performance targets
Contribute to improving the way we work with data and algorithms




Your daily work will be at the FOSS Innovation Center in Hillerød, Denmark




About you

You hold an M.Sc. or preferably a Ph.D. degree in computer science or engineering or similar education, and have:




Expertise in using Python and libraries such as pandas and NumPy
Strong experience in training of machine learning models using deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Knowledge on best practices for ML development
Understanding of image analysis and computer vision libraries such as OpenCV
Experience with development pipelines in cloud services such as Azure, AWS, or tools such as MLflow or are willing to learn
Understanding on how to optimize deep learning models for deployment on edge devices is a plus

We expect you to have an interest in:




The data analysis chain of analytical instrument
Exploration of data in problem solving
Developing real-life food/agri applications to benefit FOSS customers
Staying up to date with the latest development with AI/ML domain




As a person you are structured and self-driven when part of a strong team. You are curious on new problems and thrive on solving difficult tasks. Your record of accomplishments shows an ability to understand complex systems and to work systematically with troubleshooting incl. designing and performing experiments. Further, you are open minded and want to succeed as a team and help your colleagues. If you recognize yourself in the above description, we look forward to hearing from you.




We offer

We offer a motivating job in an international, dynamic, and innovative organization. We are market leaders within our field and very proud of the results we deliver. Innovation is the foundation for FOSS´ success and we therefore have a strong focus on R&D and work closely together with universities. FOSS is small enough for you to get high influence in the job, and big enough for career development.

The daily work takes place in an innovative and cross-disciplinary environment offering exciting tasks and the possibility to learn new things every day. You will be part of the Machine Learning & Chemometrics team in R&D, which is responsible for algorithmic innovation and development of FOSS’ solutions. As a team, we hold a high level of experience within data analysis, machine learning, chemometrics, and application knowledge, and strive at delivering cutting-edge creative and robust algorithmic solutions. We are open-minded to new ideas and have an informal tone.




Application

Send us your application via the link below. We screen applications as they come in, so apply now - better today than tomorrow! Any questions can be directed to Senior Scientist Erik Schou Dreier (+45 4063 8708 or esd@foss.dk) or Director Lars Nørgaard (+45 2761 6958 or lno@foss.dk).




All applications for vacant positions will be welcomed and will be considered on the relative merits of the applicant against the role profile for the position regardless of nationality, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, parental responsibilities, age, religion, or belief. FOSS is committed to maintaining an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. You can help us sustain an unbiased recruitment process by not including photo or age in your application.




FOSS

Today, more than 8 billion people around the world are dependent on nutritional food. Tons of food being produced in a million different ways and under varying conditions, creating challenges all the way from field to fork. One of them, obviously, being the effects it has on climate change.

FOSS helps the world’s 100 biggest food companies and more than 40,000 others around the world navigate exactly that with intelligent, data-driven and innovative analytical solutions. We are making sustainability a better business and we’re doing so as global market leader in our field – improving food quality, minimizing food waste, ensuring food safety, and securing fair payment.

Join a pioneering and innovative company in the food and agriculture industry. A company on a mission, with offices all around the world and 1,700 talented colleagues from more than 32 different countries.

Apply for job as Data Scientist – Machine Learning and Computer Vision in R&D

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
This role offers a diverse and challenging role, tackling various tasks for different companies using multiple technologies. You will build data pipelines and deploy machine learning solutions, collaborating closely with data scientists and solution managers.

Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain APIs
Manage cloud setups and DevOps
Analyze customer IT systems for ML solution integration
Create ML pipelines to integrate ML services into IT systems

Required Qualifications

Experience deploying machine learning models
Proficiency in Python
Professional proficiency in Danish

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with various database types (relational, graph, NoSQL, document)
Familiarity with cloud environments (AWS, Azure)
Background in software development or data engineering

Personal Attributes

Strong communication skills with customers and stakeholders
Independent and quick to learn new technologies and solve problems
Business-oriented with an interest in the interaction between software and business value
Team player who values cooperation and knowledge sharing

Please send over your CV and this will be reviewed immediately


Darwin Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

Title: Lead Data & AI Scientist
Description:
Do you want to research and build advanced analytics solutions using the latest tech? Are you looking to have a global impact by productionizing state-of-the-art advanced analytics solutions?




Join our Advanced Analytics & AI team to help improve and grow our data science portfolio – and become one of the leading minds behind ECCO’s future setup for advanced analytics. Making your mark on data science at ECCO, you will help empower business units to make data-driven decisions and even automate operations.




Join our Data & AI tech hub in Copenhagen

We lead the data science initiatives and capabilities in the ECCO Group and drive an ambitious strategy to fundamentally improve how ECCO operates based on data. This means working with the entire value chain – from logistics and sales to marketing, pricing and store operations.




As a Lead Data Scientist, you will develop, implement and deliver complex solutions, ranging from exploratory analyses to automated solutions in production. Using DevOps and DataOps pipelines, you will deploy and maintain solutions, and you will:




Be a leading mind in the Data Science & Machine Learning product team, working closely together with skilled ML engineers and (Sr) Data Scientists
Scope and develop new data science products, e.g. for price optimisation, inventory management, marketing analytics, consumer analytics, pricing, demand sensing, etc.
Clean, prepare and synthesise data for use in descriptive analysis, as well as predictive, prescriptive and generative models
Develop and implement machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) algorithms for real-world problems by using supervised, unsupervised, semi-unsupervised and re-enforcement learning
Deliver solutions based on a modern data platform that is delivered by the Data Platform team




You enjoy applying analytics to real-life business challenges

While self-driven and resourceful, you enjoy working in teams to solve challenges and develop the best solutions. With your creative can-do mindset and strong problem-solving skills, you can find opportunities for process optimisation and test the effectiveness of different models and courses of action.




You are always interested in learning new technologies and ways of working – and open to unlearning old ones. Moreover, we imagine that you:




Hold a master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline, e.g. statistics, mathematics, engineering or operation research
Have significant experience as a Senior Data Scientist or an equivalent quantitative role with a strong focus on statistics
Have significant experience using data science/database software and programming languages, such as SQL, R and Python
Have experience with unified analytics engines such as Apache Spark and Databricks, as well as with container platform/orchestration systems such as Docker/Kubernetes
Are fluent in English and have solid communication skills; fluency in Danish is a plus.




We tackle an endless range of new opportunities

You can look forward to joining a tech hub with 30+ highly skilled, motivated, collaborative and fun-loving colleagues. We share an entrepreneurial spirit and a bias for action. With a broad mandate to experiment, explore and innovate, we are tackling an endless range of new opportunities.




We are always ready to implement new technologies into our workflow. In addition, your continued personal and professional development is essential to us, and we offer participation in internal and external courses, education and conferences supporting this development.




Are you ready for your next challenge?

We invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis, so do not hesitate to apply. Due to the summer holidays, the application deadline for this position is August 2nd, 2024. We plan to have the first calls with candidates in the second half of August.




For additional information, you can reach out to Head of Advanced Analytics & AI, Thomas Jauho THJAU@ecco.com.




Imagining yourself at ECCO? Get a glimpse of what your new exciting career entails on https://enter.ecco.com.




CREATE THE FOOTPRINTS OF TOMORROW

At ECCO, you become part of a meaningful, developing and multicultural workplace. You join a global family of more than 23,000 people who are proud to create the footprints of tomorrow.




Headquartered in Denmark, we are a family-owned company that offers international opportunities. Our offices and facilities have an informal culture and relaxed dress code - our shoe code is slightly stricter.




Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning - the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you´re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you´ll fit right in.

Join us and we guarantee lifelong learning - the speed of progress is up to you. So, if you´re curious, passionate and ready to make an impact, you´ll fit right in.

Title: Data Scientist med IT flair
Description:
YouSee søger en dygtig Data Scientist til vores team Digital Excellence i Aarhus under afdelingen Digital Service. Afdelingens mål er at digitalisere kunderejsen på tværs af vores kanaler og sikre den gode kundeoplevelse. I vores afdeling er vi ikke underlagt at arbejde med bestemte værktøjer. Tværtimod tager vi selv ansvaret for at benytte de løsninger og redskaber, vi vurderer bedst til at løse de problemstillinger, vi bliver mødt med.

Din rolle og dine opgaver:

Din primære opgave vil være at anvende ML til at forbedre interne og eksterne processer. Du vil arbejde med de nyeste ML-felter, som f.eks. LLM/RAG, hvor du løbende tilegner dig ny viden og sætter ML i en forretningsmæssig kontekst, der skaber værdi.

Din rolle vil være at medvirke til øget kvalitet og struktur i alle de essentielle dele af et ML/ETL setup, herunder:


Optimering af chatbot RAG (udvikles i Cognigy Omnichannel Agent Platform).
Sikre integration mellem systemer i forbindelse med ML projekter.
Udvikle og integrere kreative og skalérbare ML løsninger ud fra eksisterende teknologier.
Navigere i et bredt landskab af IT-løsninger, som du selv er med til definere.
Præsentation af resultater og anbefalinger.



I dine opgaver kan du se frem til både at arbejde på tværs af afdelinger og på tværs af digitale og analoge kanaler. Du vil med tiden få ansvaret for både små og store data- og analyseprojekter. Disse projekter skal bære præg af en forståelse for forretningen, så der sikres værdi.

Din person:

Som Data Scientist vil du ofte blive mødt af en konkret forretningsproblematik. Det er her vigtigt, at du tør indgå i god dialog med ikke-tekniske kollegaer og at kunne oversætte problematikken til en teknisk udfordring, hvorefter en teknisk løsning kan udtænkes og implementeres. Du er derfor ikke kun god til at danne relationer mellem systemer, men også danne og indgå i relationer til mennesker. Vi søger derfor en person, der er:


Nysgerrig og forandringsparat.
Positiv over for at bidrage til dialogen og samarbejdet om at finde løsninger.
Visionær med åbent sind.
Kan lide at nørde og samtidig skabe konkrete og brugbare løsninger.
Tør prøve nye og spændende løsninger, selv hvis det ikke altid fører til noget produkt, men kun læring.



Da stillingen som Data Scientist ligeledes kræver en given grad af innovativ tænkning, kan indgangsvinklen være mange. Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring fra et job eller uddannelse, der indeholder en eller flere af følgende elementer:


Udvikling i Python
Navigere i eller har kendskab til Azure
Backend-udvikling
IT-principper/økosystemer
REST API



Vi tilbyder en spændende og udviklende stilling i en dynamisk virksomhed, hvor du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dine færdigheder og arbejde med de nyeste teknologier og trends inden for data science genren. Hvis du har de nødvendige kvalifikationer og ønsker at arbejde i en spændende og innovativ virksomhed, så send os din ansøgning i dag.

Ansøgningsfrist: 07.08.2024.

Kontaktperson: Director Lars Ørnholt Kier, mobil: 21642185 (i ugerne 28-30 kontaktes Data Scientist Kristian Kristensen, mobil 42451206)

Arbejdssted: Sletvej 30, 8310 Tranbjerg J

Nuuday – We make sense with technology

Nuuday er en familie af seks stærke og velkendte brands, der arbejder for det fælles mål at få teknologien til at give mening i vores liv. Vores familie består af YouSee, Telmore, Hiper, TDC Erhverv, eesy og Relatel. Vi arbejder for at forbedre menneskers og organisationers liv med innovative løsninger inden for TV, bredbånd, netværk og telefoni og underholdning. Og vi gør det sammen. På tværs af teams, 33 nationaliteter og mere end 3500 fantastiske kollegaer. Som Danmarks førende digitale service udbyder, stræber vi hver dag efter at bruge teknologien til at skabe en mere meningsfuld fremtid for vores kunder og samfundet som helhed. Derfor er vi også altid på udkig efter markedets stærkeste udviklere, de skarpeste kommercielle folk og de bedste kreative specialister, der tør udfordre og skille sig ud. Nuuday er dedikerede til at fremme en inkluderende kultur, som værdsætter diversitet, og vi er stolte af, at give lige muligheder til alle. Alle kvalificerede kandidater vil blive vurderet uafhængigt at etnicitet, religion, køn, kønsidentitet, handicap, seksuel orientering og alle de andre karakteristika, som gør os forskellige. Læs mere om, hvordan vi behandler dine personoplysninger her: https://nuuday.dk/karriere


Show more

Det er her vigtigt, at du tør indgå i god dialog med ikke-tekniske kollegaer og at kunne oversætte problematikken til en teknisk udfordring, hvorefter en teknisk løsning kan udtænkes og implementeres. Du er derfor ikke kun god til at danne relationer mellem systemer, men også danne og indgå i relationer til mennesker. Vi søger derfor en person, der er:

  • Nysgerrig og forandringsparat.
  • Positiv over for at bidrage til dialogen og samarbejdet om at finde løsninger.
  • Visionær med åbent sind.
  • Kan lide at nørde og samtidig skabe konkrete og brugbare løsninger.
  • Tør prøve nye og spændende løsninger, selv hvis det ikke altid fører til noget produkt, men kun læring.


Da stillingen som Data Scientist ligeledes kræver en given grad af innovativ tænkning, kan indgangsvinklen være mange. Det er en fordel, hvis du har erfaring fra et job eller uddannelse, der indeholder en eller flere af følgende elementer:

  • Udvikling i Python
  • Navigere i eller har kendskab til Azure
  • Backend-udvikling
  • IT-principper/økosystemer
  • REST API


Vi tilbyder en spændende og udviklende stilling i en dynamisk virksomhed, hvor du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dine færdigheder og arbejde med de nyeste teknologier og trends inden for data science genren. Hvis du har de nødvendige kvalifikationer og ønsker at arbejde i en spændende og innovativ virksomhed, så send os din ansøgning i dag.

Ansøgningsfrist: 07.08.2024.

Kontaktperson: Director Lars Ørnholt Kier, mobil: 21642185 (i ugerne 28-30 kontaktes Data Scientist Kristian Kristensen, mobil 42451206)

Arbejdssted: Sletvej 30, 8310 Tranbjerg J

Nuuday – We make sense with technology

Nuuday er en familie af seks stærke og velkendte brands, der arbejder for det fælles mål at få teknologien til at give mening i vores liv. Vores familie består af YouSee, Telmore, Hiper, TDC Erhverv, eesy og Relatel. Vi arbejder for at forbedre menneskers og organisationers liv med innovative løsninger inden for TV, bredbånd, netværk og telefoni og underholdning. Og vi gør det sammen. På tværs af teams, 33 nationaliteter og mere end 3500 fantastiske kollegaer. Som Danmarks førende digitale service udbyder, stræber vi hver dag efter at bruge teknologien til at skabe en mere meningsfuld fremtid for vores kunder og samfundet som helhed. Derfor er vi også altid på udkig efter markedets stærkeste udviklere, de skarpeste kommercielle folk og de bedste kreative specialister, der tør udfordre og skille sig ud. Nuuday er dedikerede til at fremme en inkluderende kultur, som værdsætter diversitet, og vi er stolte af, at give lige muligheder til alle. Alle kvalificerede kandidater vil blive vurderet uafhængigt at etnicitet, religion, køn, kønsidentitet, handicap, seksuel orientering og alle de andre karakteristika, som gør os forskellige. Læs mere om, hvordan vi behandler dine personoplysninger her: https://nuuday.dk/karriere

Title: Python Developer - LLM Project
Description:
Senior Python Developer - LLM Project

Experience: 3 - 18 Years

Location: - Anywhere in the World - Permanent Remote

Contract Duration: 6 to 12 Months

Payout: USD 8 - 20 Hourly

Work timings which is :-primarily, overlap is required from 8 AM to 1 PM PST. The remaining 3 hours can be accommodated either before 8 AM PST or after 1 PM PST

Opportunity- Full Time, 8 hours, 6 months

Overlap Required: 5 hours PST timing

Must-Have

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)

At least 2+ years of relevant experience with Python

Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully

Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills.

The working hours for this role require a 5-hour overlap with Los Angeles(PST) time zone. Please make sure that the candidate is ready to work accordingly. Standard work hours are 8 AM PST - 4 PM PST.

Job Description

We are actively seeking talented Senior Python Developers to join our ambitious team dedicated to pushing the frontiers of AI technology. This opportunity is tailored for professionals who thrive on developing innovative solutions and who aspire to be at the forefront of AI advancements. You will work with different companies in the US who are looking to develop both commercial and research AI solutions.

Job Responsibilities


Write effective Python code to tackle complex issues
Use business sense and analytical abilities to glean valuable insights from public databases
Clearly express the reasoning and logic when writing code in Jupyter notebooks or other suitable mediums
Communicate and collaborate with researchers
Ensure comprehensive code documentation
Utilize your data analysis skills to develop and respond to important business queries using available datasets (such as those from Kaggle, the UN, the US government, etc.)


Job Requirements


Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science (or equivalent experience)
At least 2+ years of relevant experience with Python
Industry experience and knowledge of code quality, formatting, and best practices of software development
Excellent communication abilities to work with stakeholders and researchers successfully
Strong data analytic abilities and business sense are required to draw the appropriate conclusions from the dataset, respond to those conclusions, and clearly convey the key findings
Fluent in conversational and written English communication skills

Title: MLOps Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We have recently embarked on a transformative journey in the realm of advanced analytics, venturing into untapped territories across consumer engagement, supply chain, merchandising, and manufacturing domains. Our focus is on cultivating in-house expertise in areas such as personalization & recommendation, forecasting models, and trend analysis, aiming to elevate our innovation and customer satisfaction to unprecedented heights.

As an MLOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and maintaining the infrastructure and platform essential for scaling our machine learning systems efficiently from experimentation to production. Your contribution will be pivotal in enabling and automating data-driven decision-making processes, utilizing cutting-edge techniques and ensuring the seamless integration of machine learning models into our operational workflows.

Top of Form

Bottom of Form

Responsibilities


Design, implement and maintain the ML platform and infrastructure required for ML systems to scale
Facilitate an efficient ML route to live from experiment to production.
Develop and deploy scalable tools and services to handle machine learning training and inference
Identify and evaluate new technologies to improve performance, maintainability, and reliability of ML systems
Apply software engineering rigor and best practices to machine learning, including CI/CD, automation, etc.
Support model development, with an emphasis on auditability, versioning, and data security
Communicate with product team and data scientists and machine learning engineers to build requirements and track progress



Qualifications


Experience building end-to-end systems as a Platform Engineer, DevOps Engineer
Strong software engineering skills in complex, multi-language systems
Fluency in Python
Experience working with Infrastructure as Code, e.g. Terraform
Experience working with cloud computing and database systems (SQL, no-SQL, distributed systems, data lakes, etc) such as Databricks
Experience building custom integrations between cloud-based systems using APIs
Experience developing with containerisation (e.g Docker) and orchestration Kubernetes in cloud computing environments
Familiarity with one or more data-oriented workflow orchestration frameworks (KubeFlow, Airflow, Argo, etc.)
Ability to translate business needs to technical requirements
Strong understanding of software testing, benchmarking, and continuous integration
Experience in infrastructure, data and model monitoring & alerting (e.g. tools like NewRelic, Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack)
Exposure and understanding of FinOps best practices for the public cloud
Exposure to machine learning methodology and best practices



Preferred but not must have:


Exposure to deep learning approaches and modeling frameworks (PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras, etc.)



Education & Experience


2–5 years experience building production-quality software.
Bachelors or Masters degree and/or equivalent professional experience



Our Pandora Values:

We dream, are visionary and go beyond the obvious. 

We dare to pursue bold ambitions with courage and speed. 

We care deeply about each other, our customers and the planet we all share. Every day we strive to be a fulfilling workplace, where each of us can thrive and contribute, where talents can grow, and 

we deliver on our promises to colleagues, customers, partners and stakeholders.

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply. In compliance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Joe McBrien, TA Specialist, Global Office  @jomcb@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023. 

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Python Application Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Python developer eager to dive into the world of neurotechnology and AI within a startup setting? Affecture is searching for someone like you!

In this role, you would be responsible for building an application to be used internally at Affecture. This tool will be used to record, synchronize, display, and manage EEG, GSR, and PPG data, enhancing our capabilities in running biometric user research smoothly. Python will be used to build the tool, so proficiency in the language is mandatory. Frameworks such as NiceGUI or PySide6 will be used to build the graphical user interface. Experience with these frameworks is not required, however, it would be beneficial. On top of that, previous experience with UI design, time series data, or more specifically biometric data is a plus.

Affecture is a Copenhagen-based startup that offers game user research services to video game studios, incorporating traditional playtest methods and enhanced analysis using insights extracted from physiological data from the brain, heart, and skin. At Affecture, you will be surrounded by a team dedicated to UX, neurotechnology, and AI, providing you with the necessary resources and collaboration opportunities to apply and grow your skill set.

Our internship is flexible and doesn't require university enrolment, allowing you to join us whenever it suits you. The duration of this internship would be around two months, but we are open to adjustments to fit your schedule.

Title: Senior Python Developer/ML Ops for GCP
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready to join Mouseflow, the trailblazing leader in Web Behavior Analytics? With a global presence spanning over 100 markets globally and boasting thousands of loyal customers, Mouseflow is seeking an experienced Senior Python Developer and ML Ops, with expertise in cloud-based environments, specifically Google Cloud Platform (GCP).




Imagine yourself working with colleagues across all departments in an international organization that thrives without unnecessary hierarchy or bureaucracy. At Mouseflow we have an informal culture where your colleagues across the globe know who you are, and where everybody from student worker to CEO is only a Slack message away.

But that's just the beginning. As part of our dynamic team, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of Mouseflow together with teammates who truly believe that the right, dedicated talent and joy of work means success for our company. With Mouseflow, you'll experience an atmosphere where your voice is heard, and your contributions make a real impact.




The ideal candidate will demonstrate advanced proficiency in Python, robust experience in building robust and scalable applications using modern Python frameworks and tools. Experience is required with Pydantic and FastAPI, as well as a deep understanding of Google Cloud Platform services, specifically Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, and Google Cloud Storage. Additionally, hands-on experience in productionalizing machine learning models and with ML Ops practices. The Job role is a part of a 4 person Data Science team, reporting to the Director of Data Science.




Job Contents

closely with the app and feature development teams in designing, planning and implementing combined development efforts to strengthen our product.
develop, and maintain high-performance Python applications using Pydantic and FastAPI, and running on Google Cloud Platform
and deploy machine learning models in production environments, following ML Ops best practices
and maintain our data infrastructure and pipelines within the Google Cloud environment focusing on high availability and real-time data processing.
clean, maintainable, and well-documented code, and perform code reviews and feedback to team members




Qualifications

or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
of 5 years of professional experience with Python development, with at least 2 years of experience using Google Cloud Platform and services such as BigQuery, Dataflow, Cloud Run, and Cloud Functions.
skills in Python development and dedication to good software development principles and architecture.
with implementation and deployment of containers and docker images for large-scale end-user applications on Google Cloud Platform
experience with Google Cloud Platform, particularly Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, BigQuery, Vertex AI.
with ML Ops practices and tools for productionalizing machine learning models




What we offer

unique opportunity to join an amazing SaaS company with a Scandinavian working culture and offices in Austin, Texas, and Copenhagen, Denmark, as well as people working remote from all over the world.
hierarchies, short communication channels, and large scope for decision-making.
and work-life balance in an established SaaS company, leading in our market.
position is based in our SOHO office in the best location in central Copenhagen’s old meatpacking district – 10 minutes’ walk from Copenhagen central station







For more information about the job, please feel free to contact our HR & Talent acquisition Partner Marlene de Voss at mv@mouseflow.com




Apply

Please send your resume/CV via Linkedin.

As we interview candidates continuously, we kindly ask you to send your application as soon as possible.




About Mouseflow

Mouseflow is one of the most successful software companies in web analytics, developing innovative software since 2009. In 2018, Offspring Capital acquired Mouseflow with the clear strategy of taking Mouseflow to the next level. Mouseflow is growing fast and gaining broad recognition in the market. It was recently recognized in the G2 list of Top 100 Software Products, across all industries. And it has received the coveted Børsen Gazelle award 6 times in a row, recognizing its place among the fastest growing companies in Denmark.

Our team is distributed between our offices in Copenhagen, Denmark and Austin, Texas. We serve more than 210,000 customers in 100+ countries. Our customers consist of the world’s biggest brands and our users range from entry-level associates to Directors in Marketing, Product, Analytics, UX, and CRO teams.

Title: Platform Engineer (Python)
Description:
Join Our Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading

Platform Engineer (Python) in Copenhagen

This summer, we’re expanding our Tech Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading. We are seeking platform engineers with a software development background, preferably in Python, and with experience in making critical technological choices, designing, and implementing data stores and pipelines, and producing high-quality software with a keen focus on delivering value.

If your skills and interests align with this opportunity, and you're excited about working for a company dedicated to the energy transition, consider applying for this exciting opportunity at Copenhagen Energy Trading.

As a young and rapidly expanding energy trading firm, we welcome candidates with varying levels of experience. So don’t hesitate to apply if you only have a few years under your belt.

About The Role

As a Platform Engineer, you’ll be joining our Tech Team that is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the critical infrastructure and platform services powering our analytics and many of our business functions.

You will get to develop resilient front-end and back-end applications, understand and codify complex business logic, automate tests, define infrastructure-as-code and workflow deployments declaratively - and much more, but everything as code. We are a bunch of Pythonistas, but we're also flexible and open towards other languages, if needed.

What is especially intriguing about this role is the direct impact your contributions can have on the improvement of our trading operations. You will be seated close to your trading colleagues, which makes it easy to collaborate and share new ideas on how we can make our solutions even better.

The position will be based at our headquarters located in the district of Carlsberg City in Central Copenhagen.

Responsibilities

Software: Design and implement scalable, reliable, and efficient software solutions, including data pipelines for ingesting and transforming data. Help set and follow software best practices to influence the way we build, document, review and test our software. You must be a fighter of technical debt in code bases.
Infrastructure & Cloud: Work on enhancing our platform infrastructure spanning the entire data lifecycle from ingestion and data transformation to machine-learning model management and reporting. We are cloud-native and run on Azure. You and the team are responsible for developing and securing our cloud infrastructure.
Automation & DevOps: Automate processes and optimize DevOps practices to streamline development and deployment environments.
Security and Compliance: Ensure security, performance, and compliance standards in everything we do.
Containerization: Leverage containerization for deploying our applications, while ensuring the reliability and security of the containerized applications throughout their lifecycle.
Analysis: Conduct various ad hoc analyses to assist in decision-making processes. Often, this will involve running proof-of-concept experiments on new technologies and tools to enhance the platform’s capabilities.
Support: Participate in on-call rotations for platform support and maintenance, assisting in troubleshooting platform-related issues, and occasionally addressing other technology-related concerns within the company.

Qualifications and Experience

Education: A master’s or bachelor’s degree with a strong technological basis, e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or other relevant fields.
Software Development Experience: Proven proficiency in crafting Python software solutions that are not only functional but also production ready. Ideally, your experience should encompass managing challenges related to scalability, performance, and reliability.
Python Proficiency: A strong command of Python programming language is a must. If Event loops, context managers, type-hints and generators are all parts of your vocabulary, then that is awesome.
DevOps and Deployment: Experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes) is advantageous. You should be comfortable deploying applications to cloud platforms like AWS or Azure. Big plus, if you have experience in achieving parity between production, staging and dev.
Database Skills: Some experience with database design, development, and optimization, preferably with PostgreSQL would be great.
Communication Skills: Excellent problem-solving and communication skills with full professional proficiency in English.
Electricity markets: A genuine interest in learning about electricity markets.
Technology-enthusiast: A strong enthusiasm for staying up to date with emerging technologies is like icing on the cake.

What We Offer

At Copenhagen Energy, we're committed to fostering a dynamic and inclusive work environment where your talents and contributions are recognized and valued. When you join our team, you'll benefit from:

Exceptional Team: Join a team of professional and highly ambitious colleagues who continuously set the bar high, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the energy trading market. We do not use either SAFe or Scrum but follow a Kanban-style iterative approach towards agility. We fight technical debt and muda, mura and muri in every process.
Thrilling growth environment: Be a part of a young and rapidly growing company with an authentic start-up atmosphere. Here, your innovative ideas will be celebrated, and your contributions will be recognized.
Impact: Be part of a visionary organization driving positive change in the energy sector, and impact how we become more technology driven as an organization.
Attractive compensation: Receive a competitive salary package with benefits.
Flexible Work Arrangements: We value work-life balance and offer the freedom to work from the comfort of your own home.
Social and Professional Events: Enjoy a well-rounded work experience with various social and professional events, including sports activities and parties, fostering a strong team spirit and camaraderie.

About Us

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.

We specialize in short-term proprietary wholesale power trading in Europe. We work with modern technologies, and we have the best people working with us. Data and advanced analytics fuel our deep insights into the electricity markets and enable us to develop discretionary as well as system-based trading strategies that move power to where it is needed the most.

Since we believe in a culture of collaborative growth, we do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.

Next steps

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. For more information you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen jcj@copenhagen-energy.com.

Show more
HTML:
Join Our Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading

Platform Engineer (Python) in Copenhagen

This summer, we’re expanding our Tech Team at Copenhagen Energy Trading. We are seeking platform engineers with a software development background, preferably in Python, and with experience in making critical technological choices, designing, and implementing data stores and pipelines, and producing high-quality software with a keen focus on delivering value.

If your skills and interests align with this opportunity, and you're excited about working for a company dedicated to the energy transition, consider applying for this exciting opportunity at Copenhagen Energy Trading.

As a young and rapidly expanding energy trading firm, we welcome candidates with varying levels of experience. So don’t hesitate to apply if you only have a few years under your belt.

About The Role

As a Platform Engineer, you’ll be joining our Tech Team that is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the critical infrastructure and platform services powering our analytics and many of our business functions.

You will get to develop resilient front-end and back-end applications, understand and codify complex business logic, automate tests, define infrastructure-as-code and workflow deployments declaratively - and much more, but everything as code. We are a bunch of Pythonistas, but we're also flexible and open towards other languages, if needed.

What is especially intriguing about this role is the direct impact your contributions can have on the improvement of our trading operations. You will be seated close to your trading colleagues, which makes it easy to collaborate and share new ideas on how we can make our solutions even better.

The position will be based at our headquarters located in the district of Carlsberg City in Central Copenhagen.

Responsibilities

  • Software: Design and implement scalable, reliable, and efficient software solutions, including data pipelines for ingesting and transforming data. Help set and follow software best practices to influence the way we build, document, review and test our software. You must be a fighter of technical debt in code bases.
  • Infrastructure & Cloud: Work on enhancing our platform infrastructure spanning the entire data lifecycle from ingestion and data transformation to machine-learning model management and reporting. We are cloud-native and run on Azure. You and the team are responsible for developing and securing our cloud infrastructure.
  • Automation & DevOps: Automate processes and optimize DevOps practices to streamline development and deployment environments.
  • Security and Compliance: Ensure security, performance, and compliance standards in everything we do.
  • Containerization: Leverage containerization for deploying our applications, while ensuring the reliability and security of the containerized applications throughout their lifecycle.
  • Analysis: Conduct various ad hoc analyses to assist in decision-making processes. Often, this will involve running proof-of-concept experiments on new technologies and tools to enhance the platform’s capabilities.
  • Support: Participate in on-call rotations for platform support and maintenance, assisting in troubleshooting platform-related issues, and occasionally addressing other technology-related concerns within the company.

Qualifications and Experience

  • Education: A master’s or bachelor’s degree with a strong technological basis, e.g., Computer Science, Physics, Mathematics, or other relevant fields.
  • Software Development Experience: Proven proficiency in crafting Python software solutions that are not only functional but also production ready. Ideally, your experience should encompass managing challenges related to scalability, performance, and reliability.
  • Python Proficiency: A strong command of Python programming language is a must. If Event loops, context managers, type-hints and generators are all parts of your vocabulary, then that is awesome.
  • DevOps and Deployment: Experience with CI/CD pipelines, containerization (Docker), and orchestration (Kubernetes) is advantageous. You should be comfortable deploying applications to cloud platforms like AWS or Azure. Big plus, if you have experience in achieving parity between production, staging and dev.
  • Database Skills: Some experience with database design, development, and optimization, preferably with PostgreSQL would be great.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent problem-solving and communication skills with full professional proficiency in English.
  • Electricity markets: A genuine interest in learning about electricity markets.
  • Technology-enthusiast: A strong enthusiasm for staying up to date with emerging technologies is like icing on the cake.

What We Offer

At Copenhagen Energy, we're committed to fostering a dynamic and inclusive work environment where your talents and contributions are recognized and valued. When you join our team, you'll benefit from:

  • Exceptional Team: Join a team of professional and highly ambitious colleagues who continuously set the bar high, pushing the boundaries of what's possible in the energy trading market. We do not use either SAFe or Scrum but follow a Kanban-style iterative approach towards agility. We fight technical debt and muda, mura and muri in every process.
  • Thrilling growth environment: Be a part of a young and rapidly growing company with an authentic start-up atmosphere. Here, your innovative ideas will be celebrated, and your contributions will be recognized.
  • Impact: Be part of a visionary organization driving positive change in the energy sector, and impact how we become more technology driven as an organization.
  • Attractive compensation: Receive a competitive salary package with benefits.
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: We value work-life balance and offer the freedom to work from the comfort of your own home.
  • Social and Professional Events: Enjoy a well-rounded work experience with various social and professional events, including sports activities and parties, fostering a strong team spirit and camaraderie.

About Us

Copenhagen Energy Trading A/S was founded in 2021 and is part of Copenhagen Energy Group.

We specialize in short-term proprietary wholesale power trading in Europe. We work with modern technologies, and we have the best people working with us. Data and advanced analytics fuel our deep insights into the electricity markets and enable us to develop discretionary as well as system-based trading strategies that move power to where it is needed the most.

Since we believe in a culture of collaborative growth, we do not have a system of bureaucratic policies or rigid hierarchy. We support a strong sense of team spirit, surrounded by a like-minded team and an easy-going work culture.

Next steps

All applicants are welcome. At Copenhagen Energy Trading we believe that diversity, equality, and inclusion are fundamental in the creation of an inspirational workplace that enables us to be innovative and creative. For more information you are welcome to contact Jens Christian Johannsen jcj@copenhagen-energy.com.

Title: Forretningsorienteret Data Scientist
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vi søger en erfaren Data Scientist, der udover modellering, data og software kompetencer også evner og har lyst til et tæt samarbejde med forretningen omkring implementering og anvendelse af vores modeller, samt tilhørende benefit realisering. Vi arbejder med at optimere salg og fastholdelse ved at personalisere kundeoplevelsen baseret på data og modeller.

Om os | Et stærkt analysemiljø

Du bliver en del af et mindre AI & Data Science team i Technical Excellence i Privat DK-divisionen, der også omfatter vores Portfolio Management og Pricing teams, og hvor vi har mange års erfaring med at arbejde med data og modeller i en forretningskontekst. Tryg Privat DK har en årlig præmieindtægt på 12 mia. kr. og er Trygs største forretningsområde. Stillingen er placeret i Trygs hovedkontor i Ballerup.

Om rollen | Understøt kunderejsen i Tryg

Som vores nye Data Scientist vil du være ansvarlig for en stor del af end-to-end arbejdet, fra problemformulering, opbygning af analyse datasæt, modellering, samt implementering og benefit opfølgning, herunder at designe, bygge og skalere machine learning algoritmer til processering og analysering af store data strømme.

Vi arbejder bl.a. indenfor churn modellering, lead generering, produkt anbefaling, mer- og opsalg, next best offer således, at vi på bedst mulig måde understøtter kunderejsen for Trygs kunder med datadrevne kundeanalyser. Du har mulighed for at præge dine arbejdsopgaver ved at bidrage til analyser af hvilke forretningsproblemstillinger, som vi bidrager til løsning af.

Vores teknologi stack indeholder bl.a. Azure, Kafka, MongoDB, Docker, Kubernetes og Python. Herpå bygger vi machine learning modeller, der udstilles til vores produktionssystemer via API’s. Vores analytiske platform er stadig under udvikling, så du vil også skulle håndtere issues indenfor data, tools og infrastruktur, men vi er godt på vej i den rigtige retning.

En vigtig del af jobbet er at kommunikere direkte med forretnings interessenter, for at forstå deres udfordringer og forretningsprocesser, og derefter evne at omforme dette til relevante data og model løsninger, herunder dashboards, insights, machine learning algoritmer, A/B testing m.v., som medvirker til at optimere beslutningsprocesser og kundeprocesser.

Om dig | Kompetent, erfaren og forretningsorienteret

Vi søger en passioneret, self-driven og ambitiøs Data Scientist med erfaring med at bygge machine learning applikationer i en forretningskontekst. Du har både en række data og modellerings kompetencer kombineret med et godt forretningsmindset. Desuden har du:


Bred kompetence i machine learning og statistiske metoder, herunder Deep Learning, Boosting metoder, A/B testing, causal inferens, overlevelsesanalyse m.v.
Praktisk erfaring med at bygge machine learning algoritmer, data pipelines, data engineering arbejde og deployment pipeline for machine learning algoritmer
Erfaring med følgende værktøjer, som vi anvender: Python, Gitlab, Kafka, MongoDB, SQL, No-SQL, Kubernetes, Docker, Azure, Linux, Cloud Computing, Webservices, Jupyterlab, Java, PyTorch, Tensorflow og Sklearn
Interesse i GDPR, AI act, data etik m.v. således at du kan sikre en stærk compliance i dit arbejde
En stærk og relevant uddannelsens baggrund i Machine Learning, Statistik, Matematik, Økonomi, Computer Science eller lignende.


Du e vner og trives med forretningsdialog, og besidder gode kommunikations- og stakeholder management kompetencer. Endvidere har du en interesse i Trygs forretning, systemer og processer, da det kræver et godt domæne kendskab, for at kunne levere værdiskabende modeller og løsninger.

Nysgerrig?

Send din ansøgning allerede i dag og senest d. 11 august 2024.Når den rette kandidat er fundet, afsluttes rekrutteringsprocessen. Hvis du har spørgsmål er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Technical Excellence, og leder af AI & Data Science i Privat DK, Bjørn Sandqvist på bjoern.sandqvist@tryg.dk

job rekvisition ID: 26034

Vi er en del af Solsikkeprogrammet og opfordrer alle uanset kønsidentitet, alder, baggrund, handikap eller oprindelse til at søge stillingen. Vi er stolte af at have høj medarbejdertilfredshed, stærk faglighed og lige muligheder for at udvikle sin karriere i Tryg-koncernen. Tryg er Skandinaviens største skadesforsikringsselskab med aktiviteter i Danmark, Norge og Sverige. I Danmark består koncernen blandt andet af Tryg, Alka, TJM og Tryg Garanti. TryghedsGruppen er hovedejer af Tryg-koncernen og står bag TrygFonden. Sammen arbejder vi hver dag, på hver vores måde, for at gøre danskernes hverdag mere tryg. Se mere på www.tryg.dk

Title: Turbine/Blade Data Scientist
Description:
With the ongoing green transition and the dynamic growth of the wind energy sector, we are embarking on an exciting and challenging journey. Join us as we are currently seeking a candidate with experience in the wind industry to strengthen our digital R&D team.




About this position

As our new Turbine/Blade Data Scientist, you will join our R&D team, which includes software developers, data analysts, fiber optic experts, and hardware developers. You will work closely with specialists in electronics, optics, and sensor technology in the Sensors and Embedded Software and Digital & Cloud Solutions departments. This collaboration aims to deliver innovative sensing solutions that enhance the efficiency of wind turbines worldwide.

We are looking for someone with a background in the wind industry who can bring their ideas and solutions to both new and existing standard solutions.




Your main tasks and responsibilities

As a Turbine/Blade Data Scientist, you will develop concepts and algorithms with inputs from customers and internal specialists for all our sensing products and solutions. By developing systems that feed real-time data to the wind turbine controllers, your contributions will directly help make wind energy more efficient and affordable.




Furthermore, you will:

Continuously improving our codebase and testing infrastructure.
Implement production ready concepts and technical solutions addressing market challenges.
Improve and simplify existing blade monitoring and optimization solutions. This includes autonomous bending moment calibration and autonomous ice detection.
Regularly evaluate new possible concepts and algorithms.




Your qualifications and skills

Have a Physics degree, Wind Energy Master, or similar educations.
Have strong Python programming skills.
Experience with load and control within wind energy.
Be able to transform blade dynamics into software algorithms.




Furthermore, it is an advantage if you have:

Worked with measurement data.
Speak English fluently, since you will be part of a global organization.




Your personality

You are a structured person with a focus on configurable, efficient, and maintainable solutions.

You thrive in a team with a wide range of skills and in a global, collaborative environment filled with curiosity, ideas, and suggestions.




Apply for this job

Polytech offers this position in a dynamic company working toward the green transition in collaboration with the major players in the wind industry. We can offer you a collaborative and supportive environment with great colleagues, and opportunities for personal and professional development.




You will be based at our Herning office.




For further information about this position, you are welcome to contact Senior Manager, Embedded Software Jeppe Frandsen, jfr@polytech.com or +45 41 99 85 14.




To apply for this position, please submit your application through our applications portal. Applications are welcome both in English and Danish. Please note that applications via e-mails are not accepted due to GDPR. We are conducting interviews on an ongoing basis and will take down the job ad once the right candidate is identified.




Polytech is an equal opportunity employer and promotes a diverse workforce. We therefore encourage everyone with the right skills to apply for our open positions.




About Polytech

At Polytech, we improve the durability and performance of wind turbines. Founded in 1994 we are now front-runners in developing holistic solutions for OEMs, owners, and developers in the wind industry within areas of lightning protection, leading edge protection, blade monitoring and optimization, transport, and subsea.

Title: Soon-to-be or newly graduated Software Developer
Description:
Are you passionate about developing and delivering valuable software solutions that help improve the daily lives of our customers in the defence sector? Then seize this opportunity to get your career off to an exciting start at Systematic! The knowledge and drive that you will undoubtedly bring to the job will be greatly valued from day one.

Developing excellent software to save lives
At Systematic, we believe that software, when built and used properly, can help create a better society for everyone. As a Software Developer within our Defence business area, you will have the opportunity to develop software solutions that simplify complex processes and increase efficiency for our customers.

Our teams value collaboration and a commitment to excellence, which means you will have the chance to work closely with and learn from experienced professionals who are dedicated to delivering high-quality software solutions. From your first day with us, you will receive comprehensive training and ongoing support to ensure your success – and this includes having a mentor. We know that you still have to learn, but what better way to learn than by doing it?

Right now, we are looking for new colleagues who are passionate about software development and making a difference in the world. So, if you share this passion with us and are excited about the prospect of working on meaningful projects that have a positive impact on society while growing your professional software competencies, we sincerely hope that you apply.

Never stop developing
You will work alongside dedicated colleagues who share your passion for creating the best solutions for our customers. We encourage knowledge sharing and are constantly trying to develop smarter processes. In a working environment characterised by high levels of responsibility, influence, and freedom, you can grow and determine your path, either as a Software Specialist, Software Architect or Project Manager.

This job is for you if you want to work with various technological solutions and methods. It is an advantage for your work if you are familiar with some of the following technologies, which we use:


Java EE, .NET (C#), Scala – here, experience with Java would be a plus
HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Angular/AngularJS)
REST, HTTP/S
XML
SQL (MSSQL, MySQL)
Spring Boot
Docker
Kubernetes



However, let us talk to see whether we can find the perfect match for you! As long as you bring the foundation and motivation, we can support you in learning much of the rest. 

You have ambitions for both our software and your career
We are looking for new colleagues with a master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or something similar. Especially if you are about to graduate and are keen to apply your technological skills. The specific tech stack that you will work with depends on your interests and which team you will join.

Nevertheless, it is advantageous if:


You are cooperative and strive to make a positive contribution to team dynamics.
You are ambitious and always working to improve yourself as a motivated team player.
You work systematically while paying close attention to detail, and you take pride in understanding complex solutions and customer challenges.
You are fluent in English, as it is our corporate language used daily in conversations with colleagues worldwide.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

What To Expect From Systematic
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your career with us
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis and expect to conduct interviews in June and July as we wish to welcome our new colleagues for a thorough onboarding programme starting September 1st. So click Apply Now and send us your CV today.

If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Julie Lysbjerg Christensen, Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant, for more information about the position.

Get in touch

Julie Lysbjerg Christensen

Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about developing and delivering valuable software solutions that help improve the daily lives of our customers in the defence sector? Then seize this opportunity to get your career off to an exciting start at Systematic! The knowledge and drive that you will undoubtedly bring to the job will be greatly valued from day one.

Developing excellent software to save lives
At Systematic, we believe that software, when built and used properly, can help create a better society for everyone. As a Software Developer within our Defence business area, you will have the opportunity to develop software solutions that simplify complex processes and increase efficiency for our customers.

Our teams value collaboration and a commitment to excellence, which means you will have the chance to work closely with and learn from experienced professionals who are dedicated to delivering high-quality software solutions. From your first day with us, you will receive comprehensive training and ongoing support to ensure your success – and this includes having a mentor. We know that you still have to learn, but what better way to learn than by doing it?

Right now, we are looking for new colleagues who are passionate about software development and making a difference in the world. So, if you share this passion with us and are excited about the prospect of working on meaningful projects that have a positive impact on society while growing your professional software competencies, we sincerely hope that you apply.

Never stop developing
You will work alongside dedicated colleagues who share your passion for creating the best solutions for our customers. We encourage knowledge sharing and are constantly trying to develop smarter processes. In a working environment characterised by high levels of responsibility, influence, and freedom, you can grow and determine your path, either as a Software Specialist, Software Architect or Project Manager.

This job is for you if you want to work with various technological solutions and methods. It is an advantage for your work if you are familiar with some of the following technologies, which we use:

  • Java EE, .NET (C#), Scala – here, experience with Java would be a plus
  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Angular/AngularJS)
  • REST, HTTP/S
  • XML
  • SQL (MSSQL, MySQL)
  • Spring Boot
  • Docker
  • Kubernetes


However, let us talk to see whether we can find the perfect match for you! As long as you bring the foundation and motivation, we can support you in learning much of the rest. 

You have ambitions for both our software and your career
We are looking for new colleagues with a master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or something similar. Especially if you are about to graduate and are keen to apply your technological skills. The specific tech stack that you will work with depends on your interests and which team you will join.

Nevertheless, it is advantageous if:

  • You are cooperative and strive to make a positive contribution to team dynamics.
  • You are ambitious and always working to improve yourself as a motivated team player.
  • You work systematically while paying close attention to detail, and you take pride in understanding complex solutions and customer challenges.
  • You are fluent in English, as it is our corporate language used daily in conversations with colleagues worldwide.


Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

What To Expect From Systematic
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your career with us
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis and expect to conduct interviews in June and July as we wish to welcome our new colleagues for a thorough onboarding programme starting September 1st. So click Apply Now and send us your CV today.

If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Julie Lysbjerg Christensen, Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant, for more information about the position.

Get in touch

Julie Lysbjerg Christensen

Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Applications Engineer
Description:
The Role, At a Glance

Biamp, a leading manufacturer of professional electronics for use in the installed audio and video communications market, is currently recruiting for a new Applications Engineer to join the European Customer Experience team.

Biamp Applications Engineers assist customers with technical questions, product and design problems, technical training, and occasional site visits. The position will require daily interaction with Biamp customers, consultants and sales representatives, dealing with a variety of complex technical issues. Remote work may be possible for this position. 

How You'll Contribute


Provide expert technical support to Biamp’s customers by phone and email
Troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve audio, control, video and network-related technical issues
Provide design, commissioning and optimization advice to customers using Biamp products
Make occasional site visits for troubleshooting and system optimization
Conduct customer trainings



You'll Also Assist With


Providing input and guidance for the creation of operations manuals for new products
Creating and proofreading content for Biamp’s online knowledgebase
Assisting with product set-up and staging at tradeshows
Other duties as assigned by your supervisor



A Successful Candidate Should Have


Minimum 4 years’ of experience in the Audio/Video/Control Systems industry
Relevant degree or professional qualifications desirable
Good foundational knowledge of audiovisual systems and solutions
Advanced system design, implementation, and troubleshooting skills
Good understanding of control and media networking
Good technical presentation and training skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills in Danish and English language
A serious and enthusiastic desire to provide reliable customer service



Work Environment


Up to 25% of travel
Based at a Biamp Europe office in Stockholm, Sweden or Horsens, Denmark



Who is Biamp?

We make the world’s most extraordinary audio and video solutions. For over 40 years, Biamp has created and innovated professional audiovisual solutions that enable great communication. From the smallest of rooms to the largest of venues, we empower true human connection in every space.

As We Grow To Meet Our Customers’ Needs And Evolve To Address The Challenges Of Tomorrow, One Guiding Principle Remains The Same

Biamp connects people through extraordinary audiovisual experiences

About Our Company

At Biamp, we believe the employment relationship should be reciprocal. We want you to love your job, and we want your expertise and knowledge to help drive our business forward. We champion a supportive and dynamic environment filled with passionate people who choose continuous improvement over perfection. We insist on clear, explicit decision making, believe in taking calculated risks, and celebrate tough decisions even when they don’t succeed. We look for people who desire the best from themselves and encourage the same from their coworkers. Our commitment to one another and to the common goal is the most consistent reliable path to recurring success for all of us.

Biamp is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Title: Back End Developer - 50-60K DKK - Hybrid
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Backend Node Engineer – Copenhagen – 50,000 – 60,000 DKK per month







We’ve partnered with a truly exciting tech business in Copenhagen, as they look to grow their software engineering team this year!




The company definitely fall under the ‘tech for good’ umbrella – as they help businesses and consumers to make the transition into using electric vehicles. Because of the complexity of their industry, they have a variety of products on offer to their users.




They currently have a headcount of approximately 120 – with 45 of those being in the technology team! The goal this year is to increase the team by another 8-10 people, following the successful launch of a new platform.




You’ll be working on a hybrid model in their stylish Copenhagen HQ. Most of the team do three days per week in the office, but you can do anywhere between 2-5 depending on what works best for you!




The role




Due to the amount of greenfield work & new feature development that will be happening this year they are looking to add an experienced developer to the team. This is a pure backend role so you will be utilizing Node.




The team you will be joining handles some of the most complex parts of the business’ technology, so you’ll need to be comfortable handling large-scale systems and taking ownership of features end to end when needed.




The process

Introductory call with Talent team
Call with hiring manager
Short coding challenge & meeting to review
In-person meeting to chat with the Founder & members of your new team.

On offer is up to 60,000 DKK per month plus incredibly strong pension, discretionary bonus, private healthcare and over 30 days of vacation per year!




Would you be interested in discussing this role with me?

Show more
