  • Preferred skills in noSQL, Pig, Matlab, SAS, Java, Ruby, C++, Perl, and APIs to work with available data sources.
  • Evaluate and improve all aspects of our existing ETL system.
  • Experience with big data tools and architectures, such as BigQuery, Firestore, Mysql, Cloudera Hadoop, HDFS, Hive, Snowflake and Spark.
  • Experience in Python programming language and frameworks such as Flask, AIOhttp.
  • Understanding of data structures, data modelling and software architecture.
  • Advanced knowledge of SQL queries.
  • Working knowledge of telematics interfaces and streaming solutions (MQTT, NiFi, Kafka, etc.).
  • Experience with Cloud platforms such as Google cloud platform, GCP certified would be plus.
  • Experience in multi-threading, message queues, WebSockets.
  • Experience with automation of the development and test processes through CI/CD pipeline (Gitlab, SonarQube, Artifactory, Docker containers).
  • Intermediate knowledge of API development.
  • Proving track record in building high performance, highly available and scalable systems.
  • Excellent command of the English language - written & spoken.
  • We warmly invite applications in English.

Diversity & Inclusion at Sportserve

At Sportserve, we are deeply committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe in building a team that reflects a wide array of backgrounds, skills, and perspectives. Embracing diversity not only enriches our work culture but also drives innovation and excellence. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, where everyone’s contribution is valued and respected.

If you’re a passionate about technology and looking to start your career in an international, forward-thinking Sports Betting company, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now to become part of our exciting journey!

Title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Cloud Infrastructure Engineer

Location: Leeds

Working Model: Remote (required to go in to Leeds office twice a month)

Salary: up to £65,000

Reporting to: Infrastructure Team Lead




NRG is thrilled to announce we are working alongside a leading Utility organization in their search for a Cloud Infrastructure Engineer. This is an exciting time to join our client during a dynamic period of growth as they as they enhance their core infrastructure.




Role Overview:




Reporting to the Infrastructure Team Lead, you will support cloud technologies and manage project delivery alongside internal and external support vendors across various technologies.




You will efficiently and professionally resolve incidents and requests in accordance with service level agreements. Your primary responsibility is the delivery of cloud services for our client’s network and server environments. The ideal candidate should be technically adept, with experience in designing and implementing cloud solutions.




This role provides the freedom to explore and implement optimal solutions for the organisation, while allowing you to enhance your technical skills by working with and configuring complex products and technologies.




Our client offer opportunities for growth and advancement within the company through both internal and external training programs.




Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:




Deliver high-quality IT support and manage project delivery effectively.
Configure and deploy cloud services, third-party tools, and integrations.
Provide technical consultation on existing and proposed cloud services.
Participate in planning and scoping for highly available cloud solutions.
Assist the Service Desk team with the support of existing cloud services and infrastructure as needed.
Maintain and create essential technical documentation.
Embrace a DevOps culture and stay updated with the latest industry cloud offerings.




Job Requirements:




Manage infrastructure and provide third-line support, resolving issues swiftly and efficiently.
Proficiency with core AWS services, including EC2, Storage, IAM, SNS, Lambda, Databases, Route 53, CloudWatch, CloudTrail, API Gateways, and Systems Manager.
Experience in deploying infrastructure as code.
Oversee and sustain the cloud infrastructure to ensure optimal performance and efficiency.
Experience in deploying and maintaining code pipelines.
Capability to understand and manage AWS VPC network roles, such as Transit Gateways, Direct Connect, VPNs, ACLs, NACLs, Peering, and Route Tables.
Knowledge of DevOps principles, including continuous delivery and continuous integration.
Experience in configuring and maintaining server OS systems.
Familiarity with AWS billing and management.
Experience in performing root cause analysis to identify and resolve issues.
Exposure to infrastructure project delivery.
Familiarity of high availability, backup technologies, RTO, and RPO.
Strong understanding of AWS security best practices
Participation in an after-hours on-call rotation (1 in 4 weeks)




Desirables:




ITIL practices and knowledge of change control.
Understanding of networking topologies, such as switching, VLANs, routing, remote access, and various switching layers.
Familiarity with additional AWS services such as IoT, Machine Learning, auto-scaling, and containerization.
Experience with cloud automation tools like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, and JSON.
Experience with FortiGate routers and firewalls.
Relevant certifications, including:
AWS Certified Solutions Architect – Associate Level
AWS Certified SysOps Administrator – Associate Level
AWS Certified Developer – Associate Level
ITIL certification.




For more information or to apply, click Apply Now and a member of our team will be in touch.

Title: Field Service Engineer - FULL TRAINING
Description:
Job Description

Field Service Engineer (FULL TRAINING) Ideally located in Leeds, Bradford, York or Huddersfield area £30,000 - £34,000 + Door to Door Pay + Overtime + Vehicle + Full Product Training + Progression + Development + Benefits Excellent opportunity for a trainee field service engineer to join a multi-, market leading company where you will be fully trained on their products/machinery with a chance to progress your career and skillsets. Are you a Service Engineer with Electrical experience? Are you looking for an autonomous role where you will be given the opportunity to develop your skills on bespoke products and equipment? The company themselves are world renowned manufacturers that cater to the Food, Beverage, Pharma, Chemical, IT and Automotive industries. They are a historic and growing company with a number of expert divisions.

They look for forward thinking individuals and in return offer a competitive salary, unrivalled training and a generous benefits package. This homebased role will include full product training to allow you to provide full routine service, maintenance and repairs as a field service engineer. This position is ideal for someone who has Electrical experience who wants to work for a growing global specialist that will give you full product training and opportunities to progress. The Role Field Service Engineer Fault finding, service and repair on company equipment Homebased position £30,000 - £34,000 + Door to Door Pay + Overtime + Vehicle + Full Product Training + Progression + Development + BenefitsThe Person Service Engineer Electrical experience Full UK Driving LicenceField, Service, engineer, technician, technical, electrical, pneumatic, mechanical, maintenance, travel, site, food, beverage, pharma, chemical, IT, Auto, training, progression, repair, Leeds, Bradford, York, Huddersfield, North, England, UK Reference Number: BBBH(phone number removed) To apply for this role or to be considered for further roles, please click "Apply Now" or contact Matilda Hocknell at Rise Technical Recruitment. Rise Technical Recruitment Ltd acts an employment agency for permanent roles and an employment business for temporary roles. The salary paid will be dependent on your level of experience, qualifications and skill set. We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitable candidates

Title: Senior Clinical Data Science Lead
Description:
Job Description


Lead end to end data review activities performed on a clinical trial. Accountable for achieving clinical data science deliverables on-time, with high- quality and to agreed financial metrics.
Serve as primary point of contact for internal and external team members regarding clinical data review activities and leads these data review activities to ensure delivery of data fit for analysis.
Provides input into clinical system development activities and clinical risk management activities.


Requirements


Enhanced knowledge of clinical data management/clinical data science and data review activities.
Applied skills in project management, including the predictive elements of timelines, resource requirements and financial tracking.
Detailed understanding of protocol content and interpretation of critical data and data review requirements
Ability to react and adapt requirements, processes and timelines in an agile manner
Understand project level revenue recognition/forecasting process and provides input regarding actual and forecasts units/hrs (revenue and resources) to the CDS PM.
5-8 years of experience. An equivalent combination of education, training and relevant experience may be considered in place of the education and experience stated.

Title: Embedded Engineer
Description:
Position: Embedded Engineer

Salary: Up to £50,000 + Benefits

Office Location: Leeds




The Role: KO2 are now working with a growing engineering business in the Leeds area looking to add an experienced Embedded Engineer to their team. Our client has been growing their team due to new project work and are looking for an embedded engineer who has experience developing products from scratch and also updating existing products, adding new features and functionality.




They are looking for a low level embedded engineer who has strong programming skills in bare metal environments and is used to working close to hardware and has a strong appreciation of integration and hardware. You work will be 70% software and 30% hardware level tasks.




Skills and Experience Required:

Embedded C
Bare metal development
Microchip PIC24, dsPIC33, and ATSAM
RS232, RS485, SPI, I2C, CANbus protocols




You will be joining a multidisciplined engineering team and can expect plenty of variety in this role. Contributing at all stages of the development life cycle, writing new code, reviewing specifications, in house testing, debugging and providing the required documentation. You will be joining a team of technology enthusiasts creating software solutions that monitor, control and collect data from a range of electronic devices.




Desirable Experience:

C++ programming
Electronics design
Hardware and circuit level design




If you are looking for the opportunity to develop complex software solutions whilst working in a team development focussed environment with likeminded engineers in the Leeds area then this is the role for you.




Please contact Laurence Powell or Chris Fawcett at KO2 Embedded Recruitment Solutions Ltd to discuss this role in further detail.

Title: Java developer
Description:
Java Developer




Alscient

Leeds, UK




Why Alscient?

We provide great opportunities for people to develop and grow their career. We provide a fulfilling and enjoyable environment that supports that growth while working with the best people and teams around.

You succeed, we succeed, it’s that simple, and we like to keep it simple. That said, you will be working with the latest technologies, platforms, languages and best practices.

This role will require an excellent working knowledge of Java and related technologies.







What’s in it for you?

From your first day we will provide you with everything you need to succeed, we just need you to play your part. There will be lots to learn, but we’ll be there to support, guide and help at every stage.




As you gain experience and knowledge, we’ll help you grow your certifications and experience delivering customer solutions. You’ll be working with some of the best people in the industry who are there to help and support you on your journey.




In return we will guarantee a welcoming, inclusive and supportive culture working on exciting and progressive projects alongside one of the best packages in the industry including market leading salary, healthcare, pension, flexible working options and a personalised development plan to match your ability and ambition ensuring your personal and professional growth is in line with our commercial development.




What we need from you?

This is also simple. Our culture is non-negotiable so we need you to be passionate about your work, technically adept, open with those you work with and for you to do your best to support your colleagues and teams.




As a Java developer we expect you to hit the ground running. You will know Java well and will be comfortable using JUnit, Ant, JSON, REST, Eclipse IDE and related technologies. You will be comfortable following design documentation and specifications and maintaining them as solutions change. A knowledge of data platforms including relational DBMS platforms and SQL is necessary.




We are looking for people who are bright, talented and a pleasure to work with and alongside. Whether you enjoy working on new solutions, learning new technologies, problem solving or working with customers, we can find the best role to suit you.




Are you a good fit?

We’ve mostly covered it above so if you think you are a good fit and have a hunger to grow and develop your career with us, get in touch.




Benefits and Opportunities include:

Excellent market leading salary.
A benefit package including life assurance, pension and healthcare.
A generous holiday allowance, including a day off on your birthday.
A flexible working policy.
An inclusive, supportive and welcoming culture.
Challenging projects at the fore front of developing technologies.
A personalised development plan, including practical project experience alongside continuing supported professional certification.




You will have:

At least two years’ experience of developing Java applications and services
A working knowledge of relational DBMS platforms and SQL.
Experience of working in agile environments and the use of Jira and Confluence.
A hunger to develop, learn and grow.
A meticulous attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills including the maintenance of system documentation.
Strong analytical skills with a passion for problem solving.
A resourceful and professional curiosity, with a drive to find appropriate solutions.







If the above excites or interests you, please contact david.owen@alscient.com attaching your CV.

Title: Full Stack Developer (React/C#)
Description:
Role; Full Stack Software Engineer

Duration; 6 months

Location; Remote/Leeds 1x per month

Rate; £470/day Inside IR35

Brio Digital are currently supporting a HealthTech consultancy who are looking for a contract React Software Engineer.

We're looking for a Full Stack Software Engineer focusing on front-end with React with a back-end of C#/.Net to work on a high-profile project which delivers some of the NHS's core services. These core services are used by millions of people every year. You'll work in a cross-functional team using modern tooling to high-standards which will allow users to use systems in an effective manner.

Software Engineer essential skills;


Strong React experience.
Strong .Net/C# experience.
HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript.
Experience of working on enterprise-scale platforms.
Agile.


Apply now or email for more information.

Title: Lead Cloud Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about DevOps and eager to drive innovation in a cloud-first environment? We are a forward-thinking wealth management company dedicated to making financial advice more accessible. Enjoy the close-knit atmosphere of a smaller company with the stability and growth opportunities of a larger organization. Join us during this exciting growth period and help shape our DevOps strategy.




About Us:

We are at the forefront of wealth management, committed to providing leading-edge technology solutions. Our goal is to build the right foundations and strategy for DevOps, ensuring continuous improvement and innovation in our services.




The Role:

As the Lead DevOps Engineer, you will:

Build our DevOps engineering capability and define, evolve, and govern DevOps standards and principles.
Automate tasks from build and deployment through monitoring and alerting.
Champion a DevOps culture with automation at its core.
Support developers in building and maintaining pipelines.
Push beyond our existing baseline to introduce feature branch deployments, canary releases, and define our deploy vs release approach.
Act as the technical lead in an agile, cross-discipline squad, working with developers, SDETs, scrum masters, and product owners.
Educate and coach delivery teams to adopt a true DevOps mindset.




Key Requirements:

Demonstrable experience as a DevOps Lead in an agile organization.
Ability to clearly articulate your understanding of DevOps and DevSecOps.
Experience in driving DevOps adoption, defining best practices, and guiding developers in adhering to them.
Experience with serverless technology (Lambda, SNS, SQS)
Hands-on engineering skills in some or all of our core technical stack: TypeScript, Node.js, GitHub Actions, CircleCI, and AWS.
Preferred experience with Azure AD SSO and AWS IAM OIDC.




About You:

You are motivated by the opportunity to shape and define DevOps practices and drive their adoption. You stay updated with the latest technology developments and think beyond the obvious to explore ways to implement them.




Benefits and Perks:

Salary up to £78k
2-3 days on site per week in Leeds
25 days holiday (with the option to buy or sell 5 extra days).
4% flex fund can be taken as cash, used on benefits, or a combination of both.
Generous pension scheme – if you contribute 6%, we will contribute 15%.
Private healthcare.
Dental cover.




Join us and be a part of our innovative journey in transforming wealth management technology.

Title: Software Engineer (Back End)
Description:
Job Description

JOB TITLE: Software Engineer (Back End)

LOCATION(S): Leeds

HOURS: Full time

WORKING PATTERN: Hybrid, 40% (or two days) in the office per week

SALARY: £68,202 - £83,358 pa. dependant on experience (Leeds)

About This Opportunity

We’re looking for Back End Software Engineers to join our Mass Affluent Digital Experience (MADE) lab in Leeds.

Mass Affluent is the segment of customers with between £50,000 and £5 million in investable assets. We have close to three million Mass Affluent customers, and we are working hard to create greenfield personalised and tailored offering to ensure a beautiful banking experience. We want to provide a seamless digital experience, with the right products and services at our customers’ fingertips, but our face-to-face, telephone and secure messaging remain a vital part of our service.

What do we need to see from applicants?

Essential

We like people who come from a diverse group of backgrounds that can bring new and challenging ways of thinking to the team. As a minimum to be considered we’ll need to see evidence of the following in your CV:


Strong understanding and experience of designing, building and operating Java services (particularly microservices, RESTful APIs, and distributed systems). We use the Spring Boot framework for building our microservices.


Desirable


Experience designing, building and operating services using Cloud Native services from any major Cloud provider. We run our services on Kubernetes on GCP.
Demonstrated experience collaborating with Product and Design colleagues to drive outcomes for customers
A good understanding of Git, source code management and managing change.
Knowledge and experience of agile development practices, continuous integration and test automation (e.g. TDD, BDD).
Excellent interpersonal and team working skills
Experience of technical guidance and mentoring.


Here’s How You’ll Make a Difference


Having an excellent understanding of Agile software development and supporting continuous improvement of your team
Write modular, clean, testable applications using design principles such as SOLID and DRY
Significantly contribute to the delivery of strategic microservices that support the Mass Affluent Digital Experience offering
Contribute to levelling up how we design, build and operate software as scale within the Bank through the wider engineering community
Technically mentor and develop your colleagues, providing clear and constructive feedback, through code reviews and design documents


About Working For Us

Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms

We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture.

We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative.

And it’s why we especially welcome applications from under-represented groups.

We’re disability confident. So if you’d like reasonable adjustments to be made to our recruitment processes, just let us know.

We Also Offer a Wide-ranging Benefits Package, Which Includes


A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
An annual bonus award, subject to Group performance
Share schemes including free shares
Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping
30 days’ holiday, with bank holidays on top
A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies


Ready for a career where you can have a positive impact as you learn, grow and thrive?
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

JOB TITLE: Software Engineer (Back End)

LOCATION(S): Leeds

HOURS: Full time

WORKING PATTERN: Hybrid, 40% (or two days) in the office per week

SALARY: £68,202 - £83,358 pa. dependant on experience (Leeds)

About This Opportunity

We’re looking for Back End Software Engineers to join our Mass Affluent Digital Experience (MADE) lab in Leeds.

Mass Affluent is the segment of customers with between £50,000 and £5 million in investable assets. We have close to three million Mass Affluent customers, and we are working hard to create greenfield personalised and tailored offering to ensure a beautiful banking experience. We want to provide a seamless digital experience, with the right products and services at our customers’ fingertips, but our face-to-face, telephone and secure messaging remain a vital part of our service.

What do we need to see from applicants?

Essential

We like people who come from a diverse group of backgrounds that can bring new and challenging ways of thinking to the team. As a minimum to be considered we’ll need to see evidence of the following in your CV:

  • Strong understanding and experience of designing, building and operating Java services (particularly microservices, RESTful APIs, and distributed systems). We use the Spring Boot framework for building our microservices.

Desirable

  • Experience designing, building and operating services using Cloud Native services from any major Cloud provider. We run our services on Kubernetes on GCP.
  • Demonstrated experience collaborating with Product and Design colleagues to drive outcomes for customers
  • A good understanding of Git, source code management and managing change.
  • Knowledge and experience of agile development practices, continuous integration and test automation (e.g. TDD, BDD).
  • Excellent interpersonal and team working skills
  • Experience of technical guidance and mentoring.

Here’s How You’ll Make a Difference

  • Having an excellent understanding of Agile software development and supporting continuous improvement of your team
  • Write modular, clean, testable applications using design principles such as SOLID and DRY
  • Significantly contribute to the delivery of strategic microservices that support the Mass Affluent Digital Experience offering
  • Contribute to levelling up how we design, build and operate software as scale within the Bank through the wider engineering community
  • Technically mentor and develop your colleagues, providing clear and constructive feedback, through code reviews and design documents

About Working For Us

Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms

We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture.

We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative.

And it’s why we especially welcome applications from under-represented groups.

We’re disability confident. So if you’d like reasonable adjustments to be made to our recruitment processes, just let us know.

We Also Offer a Wide-ranging Benefits Package, Which Includes

  • A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
  • An annual bonus award, subject to Group performance
  • Share schemes including free shares
  • Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping
  • 30 days’ holiday, with bank holidays on top
  • A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies

Ready for a career where you can have a positive impact as you learn, grow and thrive?

Title: Senior Cryptography Engineer
Description:
Stott & May are looking to speak with experienced Cryptography Engineers to assist with the build and scale out of cryptographic operations within a Financial Services client.




Type: Contract/freelance – Initially 6 months | Awaiting IR35 determination

Day Rate: TBC – Market rate for this type of role

Location: Hybrid working – Some availability to work in London or Yorkshire offices advantageous




Senior Cryptography Engineer – Responsibilities:




Cryptography and Key Management
Facilitate the adoption and use of cryptographic capabilities
Contribute to implementing and operationalising secure key storage mechanisms
Assist with the implementation of cryptography processes across the team
Enable the build of secure products
Support ongoing audit and assurance activities around key protection standards
Work with the Platform Team in building pipelines (cryptography operations)
Key generation and distribution
Close collab with Cyber and InfoSec teams - integrating key management practices




Senior Cryptography Engineer – Technical:




Experience in key handling, segregation of duties
Detailed knowledge and understanding of how to respond to cryptography incidents
Previous knowledge working within a Cryptographic team
Certificate Management.
Solid understanding of HSM technologies & Thales would be great however, other (similar) competing technologies will be just fine
HashiCorp Vault experience and previous usage of would great
Solid grasp of various types of encryptions
File/Folder level encryption, database file encryption and application encryption
Communication, problem-solving, documentation, and presentation skills
Security & compliance frameworks/standards for cryptography (PCI-DSS, PCI-PIN, PCI-CPP, NIST, FIPS)




Senior Cryptography Engineer – Advantageous:




Software engineering and infrastructure as code
GitHub Actions and/or other potential CI/CD pipeline tooling
Security Architecture & design principles
Relevant certifications




Previous experience within Financial Services, Banking, Consumer Lending or Payments is very advantageous however, it is the experience within Key mgmt. and Cryptography that is necessary. If you have used the tooling mentioned above, you have a fantastic chance of securing this long-term contract opportunity!




Roles like these aren’t as common as they potentially will be moving forward therefore, this is a fantastic opportunity to really push your career both present and future forward – look forward to receiving your profile and discussing this in more detail.

Title: Lead Software Engineer
Description:
Lead React Software Engineer

Position: Lead React Software Engineer

Type: Contract

Rate: £550 per day - Inside

Duration: 4 months initial but should extend

Location: Leeds/Hybrid




As the Lead React Software Engineer, you will spearhead the development of sophisticated web applications and leverage AWS to enhance performance and scalability. Your expertise will guide the team in building scalable, high-performance solutions. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and optimal user experience.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead the design, development, and deployment of React applications with AWS services.
Architect and implement robust, maintainable code following best practices.
Mentor and guide a team of talented developers.
Collaborate with UI/UX designers to translate designs into interactive applications.
Optimize applications for maximum speed, scalability, and cloud efficiency.
Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends, technologies, and AWS services.




Required Skills and Qualifications:

Proven experience as a Lead React Software Engineer or in a similar senior role.
Extensive experience with React.js and its core principles.
Strong proficiency in JavaScript, including DOM manipulation and the JavaScript object model.
Experience with popular React workflows (such as Redux).
Familiarity with newer specifications of ECMAScript.
Expertise in AWS services (such as S3, EC2, Lambda, API Gateway).
Experience with modern authorization mechanisms, such as JSON Web Token.
Familiarity with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM, etc.
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication and leadership skills.




Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with TypeScript.
Any previous with .Net would be a bonus
Familiarity with RESTful APIs.
Knowledge of isomorphic React is a plus.
Experience with code versioning tools such as Git.
Understanding of server-side rendering.
AWS certification (Solutions Architect, Developer, etc.) is a plus.

Title: PrestaShop Developer
Description:
PrestaShop Developer

Leeds HQ with Remote working (UK only)

£45,000




WRK digital are partnered with an innovative e-commerce company looking to take their website to the next level.




We are looking for an experienced PrestaShop Developer to join a talented team and contribute to the growth and success of a successful online business.

This role is remote first (UK only)




The Role:




* Develop, customise, and maintain a PrestaShop-based e-commerce website.

* Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to PrestaShop functionality, performance, and security.

* Create and modify PrestaShop themes, templates, and modules.

* Optimise website performance, including page load times and database queries.

* Ensure compatibility with various browsers, devices, and screen sizes.

* Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices related to e-commerce and PrestaShop development.




About You:




* Proven experience as a PrestaShop Developer.

* Strong knowledge of PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS, ASP and JavaScript.

* Familiarity with Linux server administration and command-line tools.

* Experience with PrestaShop module development and customisation.

* Understanding of e-commerce concepts, SEO, and user experience.

* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

* Ability to work independently.

* Strong communication skills.




If you are passionate about web development and possess the required skills and experience, we would love to hear from you.

Please apply directly or contact daniell@wrkdigital.co.uk for more information

Title: Full Stack Engineer
Description:
hackajob is a matching platform partnering with BAE Systems Digital Intelligence assisting them in hiring the best talent and build the future. To get the chance to get matched to this role and other similar roles, click on Apply to set up your free profile.

---

BAE Systems Digital Intelligence is home to 4,800 digital, cyber and intelligence experts. They work collaboratively across 16 countries to collect, connect and understand complex data, so that governments, nation states, armed forces and commercial businesses can unlock digital advantage in the most demanding environments.




At BAE Systems Digital Intelligence, they believe that digital technology is the key to unlocking their customers’ advantage. They are a highly respected engineering organisation providing services to governments around the world. At Digital Intelligence they are proud of the mission-critical systems that they build for their customers, in areas that truly make a difference to society. They work in several sectors including Healthcare, Law Enforcement, Security, Defence, Space, Telecommunications and National and International Government, to name a few.




They have a number of Software Engineering opportunities working with a variety of technologies within our Digital Defence business unit. Specficially, they are looking for people with experience across the full stack utilising Java and Javascript.




Skills:

Essential:

Good understanding of Modern Object Orientated Programming Concepts
Full Stack Development Experience
Experience writing applications in Java or Kotlin
Experience developing with modern Web Application Frameworks in Typescript or JavaScript
Willing to travel (within UK)
Able to obtain security clearance

Desired:

Willing to work on Client site 50:50; this would be in the West of England
Experience developing React applications with TypeScript
Experience working with SQL Databases
Experience of UI testing frameworks (e.g. Cypress / Selenium)
Previous experience working as part of an Agile team
Good understanding of MDM-related technologies




At BAE you will find an environment that supports your personal development. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of different projects and technologies. Their clients are constantly moving forwards with the technology that they use, and you will move forwards with them.




These roles require security clearance; if you are not security cleared already, you must be eligible to obtain clearance.




Life at BAE Systems Digital Intelligence

They are embracing Hybrid Working. This means you and your colleagues may be working in different locations, such as from home, another BAE Systems office or a client site, some or all of the time, and work might be going on at different times of the day.

By embracing technology, they can interact, collaborate and create together, even when they're working remotely from one another. Hybrid Working allows for increased flexibility in when and where they work, helping them balance their work and personal life more effectively, and enhance well-being.




Diversity and inclusion are integral to the success of BAE Systems Digital Intelligence. They are proud to have an organisational culture where employees with varying perspectives, skills, life experiences and backgrounds – the best and brightest minds – can work together to achieve excellence and realise individual and organisational potential.




Division overview: Capabilities

At BAE Systems Digital Intelligence, they pride themselves in being a leader in the cyber defence industry, and Capabilities is the engine that keeps the business moving forward. It is the largest area of Digital Intelligence, containing Engineering, Consulting and Project Management teams that design and implement the defence solutions and digital transformation projects that make them a globally recognised brand in both the public and private sector.

As a member of the Capabilities team, you will be creating and managing the solutions that earn them their place in an ever-changing digital world.

Title: Senior Developer
Description:
Senior Web Developer – Leeds (on-site) - £30k-£40k







Would you like to join an established integrated digital agency as a web developer in a collaborative team? Offering an opportunity to work on exciting local clients in a brilliant office environment.




You will get to build websites for B2B and B2C clients. Covering client comms, developing efficient code, page speed, web performance and SEO optimisation. Also, testing sites to ensure optimal performance to then push websites live including DNS, server config and hosting.




You should have over 4 years’ experience in web development. With experience in:




WordPress & Shopify
PHP, HTML, Java Script and jQuery
MySQL
Basic understanding of API’s
Experience with GIT and modern deployment processes.







Overall, you will get to enhance your career within web development. Leading on campaigns and bringing your skills to an already well-established agency. Based in Leeds.
